ailments.name: One or both teeth are missing, there are adjacent teeth with a good state of health in the distal and mesial side
ailments.notes: A small number of teeth are lost, there are teeth on both sides with long roots, Free of decay, No pain &amp;amp;amp;amp; looseness

plans.notes: Fixed bridge
Implant restoration

ailments.name: One or both teeth are missing, there are adjacent teeth in the distal and mesial side but with a poor state of health
ailments.notes: A small number of teeth are lost, there are teeth on both sides but the roots are short or with increased mobility , unable to withstand excessive bite force

plans.notes: RPD
Implant restoration

ailments.name: Single tooth is missing at distal free-end, but the mesial adjacent teeth is healthy
ailments.notes: Long root, Free of decay, No pain &amp;amp;amp;amp; looseness

plans.notes: Implant restoration
Cantilever fixed bridge

ailments.name: Single tooth is missing at distal free-end, and the mesial adjacent teeth is not healthy
ailments.notes: Short root or increased mobility of adjacent teeth, unable to withstand excessive bite force

plans.notes: RPD
Implant restoration

ailments.name: Three or more teeth are missing
ailments.notes: Excessive tooth loss

plans.notes: Implant restoration
RPD

ailments.name: Severe dentition crowding
ailments.notes: Crowding degree&amp;gt;8mm

plans.notes: Molars distalization (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)
Interproximal reduction (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner tjherapy)
Maxillary expansion (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)
Tooth extraction (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)

ailments.name: Anterior crossbite
ailments.notes: Negative coverage of lower anterior teeth on the upper anterior teeth during clenching.

plans.notes: Braces
Fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy
Maxillary protraction

ailments.name: Anterior overjet
ailments.notes: The maximum horizontal distance from the cutting end of upper anterior teeth to the labial surface of lower anterior teeth exceeds 3mm.

plans.notes: Molars distalization (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)
Tooth extraction (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)
Interproximal reduction (fixed orthodontic or clear aligner therapy)

ailments.name: Posterior crossbite
ailments.notes: Negative coverage of the lower teeth before the upper teeth during clenching.

plans.notes: Fixed orthodontic
Clear aligner therapy

ailments.name: Posterior locking
ailments.notes: Locking jaw is a kind of malocclusion of posterior teeth. Individual or most teeth in the upper jaw are locked in the buccal side of the lower posterior teeth.

plans.notes: Clear aligner therapy
Fixed orthodontic

ailments.name: Overbite
ailments.notes: The height of anterior teeth and alveolar is overdeveloped, while that of posterior teeth and alveolar is underdeveloped.

plans.notes: Fixed orthodontic
Clear aligner therapy

ailments.name: Open bite
ailments.notes: No vertical overlap or contact between the anterior incisors.

plans.notes: Fixed orthodontic
Combined orthodontic and orthognathic treatment
Clear aligner therapy

sicknesss.name: Chronic gingivitis
sicknesss.notes: Gingival bleeding when brushing teeth or biting hard objects, gingival itching and discomfort or bad breath; plaque, calculus, bad prosthesis or other local irritants at the gingival margin; gingiva is bright red or dark red, gingival margin edema, thickened, gingival papilla is blunt hypertrophy, soft texture, stippling disappears; gingival sulcus bleeding when probing, the probing depth is mostly within 3mm, and can also be greater than 3mm, forming false periodontal pockets, without loss of attachment and alveolar bone absorption

plans.notes: Remove the etiology surgical treatment and maintenance therapy

sicknesss.name: Puberty gingivitis
sicknesss.notes: Patient is still in puberty, gingivitis is related to plaque, change of internal secretion and sex hormone; easy to occur in labial gingival margin and gingival papilla, usually in bright or dark red color, soft, easy to bleed, gingiva swells up a lot, gingival papilla bulges out; deepened gingival sulcus, usually deeper than 3mm, leading to pseudo periodontal pocket, no attachment loss or alveolar resorption

plans.notes: cause elimination/surgical treatment/maintaining treatment/Oral hygiene instruction

sicknesss.name: Caries in young children
sicknesss.notes: Children younger than 6 years old, who have one or more caries (whether cavities or not), loss (due to caries), or filling surface on any deciduous tooth, are considered as caries of young children.

plans.notes: Plaque control
Medical guidance
Fluoride Varnish
Dietary advice

ailments.name: Smooth surface caries
ailments.notes: Chalky or yellowish-brown changes on the tooth surface, the surface is rough

plans.notes: Fluoride varnish: clean the tooth surface, dry, apply Dole fluoride, fluoride foam or fluorine protective paint, and evaluate the calcification effect regularly; preventive fluoride application 2~4 times a year

ailments.name: Pit and fissure caries
ailments.notes: Caries that occurs in pit and fissure gaps and reaches the enamel layer

plans.notes: Fluid resin filling: remove decomposition and prepare holes, wet-drying, full acid etching and bonding treatment, fluid resin filling, blending and polishing

ailments.name: Without pulp exposure
ailments.notes: Crown-root vertical fracture

plans.notes: Pulp capping with resin restoration
Adjustment
Stabilization
Regular observation
Above alveolar crest: reattachment of crown

ailments.name: With pulp exposure
ailments.notes: Aches upon heat or coldness; tenderness

plans.notes: Root canal therapy and orthodontic treatment
Apexification or RCT
Preserve the pulp and ensure root closure
Crown lengthening or gingivectomy

ailments.name: Primary teeth delayed eruption
ailments.notes: Primary teeth delayed eruption

plans.notes: If patient has systematic diseases, causes should be checked out for treatment first
Usually surgery is needed to remove the impacted primary teeth, evaluating the patient&amp;amp;amp;amp;#39;s situation to decide if it is necessary to maintain space

ailments.name: Permanent teeth delayed eruption
ailments.notes: Permanent teeth delayed eruption

plans.notes: If primary teeth&amp;amp;amp;amp;#39;s eruption is impacted by loss of eruption space, recommended to consider solutions like space expansion or serial extraction
If the gingiva is partially pale, puffy and the incisal edges is reachable, partial gingivectomy could be carried out, exposing cusps or incisal edges, gingivectomy could speed up the eruption

Eruption failure caused by abnormal permanent teeth eruption direction, extract primary teeth in time and plan orthodontics treatment when permanent teeth erupt later; if it is mesial-distal impact, orthodontists&amp;amp;amp;amp;#39; evaluation is needed to choose fenestration/traction treatment or impact teeth extraction

Permanent teeth delayed growth, if it is related to systematic diseases, treat the diseases accordingly first; Certain teeth delayed growth, need to maintain space, observe tooth germs&amp;amp;amp;amp;#39; eruption regularly
For impacted permanent teeth caused by supplementary teeth, odontoma and cyst, in-time surgery should be carried out to make sure the  normal eruption of the impacted permanent teeth

sicknesss.name: Primary tooth crown fracture
sicknesss.notes: Crown fracture is quite common, usually happen to incisal corners or edges of the central incisor in the upper jaw, caries is into the medium or deep dentin

plans.notes: Adjust sharp edges
Indirect pulp capping, crown restoration
Patient is still too young, non compliant, can not finish pulp treatment, recommended to consider extraction
Root canal treatment, crown restoration

ailments.name: Simple crown-root fracture
ailments.notes: Crown and root hard tissues fracture, not affecting pulp chamber

plans.notes: Removal of pulp, restored with root canal treatment

ailments.name: Complicated crown-root fracture
ailments.notes: Crown and root&amp;amp;amp;amp;#39;s hard tissue fracture, affecting pulp chamber

plans.notes: Remove fragments, restore the crown after root canal treatment; if the facture is deep down to the alveolar socket, extraction should be done

sicknesss.name: Submerged primary teeth
sicknesss.notes: Primary teeth retained among permanent teeth when the successive permanent teeth don&amp;amp;amp;#39;t erupt

plans.notes: Extract or keep the primary teeth depending on the situation of tooth and bone mass

sicknesss.name: Submerged primary teeth
sicknesss.notes: Submerged teeth are lower than normal occlusal plane, physiological tooth movement disappears; mostly happen to primary molars, more in lower jaw than in upper jaw; X-ray check shows periodontal space disappears, root surface and alveolar bone are attached together

plans.notes: Could lead to tilt of neighbouring teeth, including unerupted permanent teeth, need to get back the normal occlusal height for the tilted submerged primary teeth
Light submerged primary teeth, observe regularly
Could possibly lead to eruption difficulty for successive permanent teeth, primary teeth with ectopic eruption need to be extracted

sicknesss.name: Permanent first molar ectopic eruption
sicknesss.notes: Permanent first molar&amp;amp;amp;#39;s mesial ridges impact distal cervix of primary second molar, crown tilts mesially

plans.notes: Reversable ectopic eruption teeth, observe them to erupt spontaneously
Irreversable ectopic eruption, early orthodontics treatment, avoiding loss of arch length and getting good bite relation

sicknesss.name: Impacted permanent teeth
sicknesss.notes: Permanent teeth don&amp;amp;amp;#39;t erupt in order and in time, while the same name teeth on the opposite side have erupted or other teeth which should erupt later than the impaired teeth have erupted already; retained or early loss of primary teeth

plans.notes: Surgical removal of odontoma, supplemental tooth or cyst
Deboning forced eruption
Combined surgical and orthodontics treatment
Gingival incision forced eruption
If it is related to systematic diseases, need to check out the causes and treat accordingly

sicknesss.name: Primary tooth lateral shift and loosens a bit
sicknesss.notes: Lateral shift brings teeth dislocation, as well as damage to the alveolar bone; when the teeth detaches from the alveolar socket partially, it will lead to occlusal trauma with the antagonist teeth; various degress of teeth loosening, gingival sulcus bleeds

plans.notes: Severe shift or loosening again after having been put back, or patients don&amp;amp;#39;t cooperate, need to consider extraction
Possibly affect permanent tooth germ, need to extract in time
If bite is not affected, no need to put back the teeth, continue to observe
Shift is not serious, but has occlusal disorder, fixation surgery is recommended to put the teeth back to original position with local anesthesia, the fixation requires around 2 weeks

sicknesss.name: Primary tooth detaches
sicknesss.notes: Tooth detaches from alveolar socket, possible fracture in the alveolar socket and soft tissue laceration

plans.notes: No more implant, check if there is any soft tissue damage or bone fracture, etc.; pay attention to oral hygiene to avoid infection

sicknesss.name: Permanent canine ectopic eruption
sicknesss.notes: Permanent canines don&amp;amp;amp;#39;t erupt between lateral incisor and permanent first molar, while erupt from other position

plans.notes: Detect as early as possible, carry out orthodontics treatment to move the teeth back to position
For cases that can not move back the teeth back to original position, could consider adjusting the canine&amp;amp;#39;s shape for better aesthetics

sicknesss.name: Primary tooth root fracture
sicknesss.notes: Main symptoms include tooth loosening, tooth extension, percussion pain, bite pain, and possible tooth dislocation

plans.notes: Primary tooth root fracture in the middle, fixation surgery could be carried out if patient cooperates, fixation requires around 4 weeks; if periodontal or pulp infection appears, extraction should be done

Primary tooth apex fracture in 1/3 position, loosen a bit, no obvious occlusal trauma, ask patient not to chew on the fractured tooth and recheck regularly, root canal treatment for the fractured tooth&#39;s upper part could be done if there is pulp necrosis or apical inflammatory resorption

If fractured tooth&#39;s upper part loosens or dislocates, extract fractured tooth&#39;s upper part and check the root situation, no need to extract the root if there is no periodontal infection, avoiding damage to permanent tooth germ, it could be resorbed or discharged gradually

ailments.name: Coronal third of the root
ailments.notes: Obvious tooth loosening, percussion pain, occlusal pain, and tooth displacement.

plans.notes: Undeveloped root: RCT after apexification.
Coordinate the crown-root ratio : reduction fixation
Root development completion, RCT.
Root is too short: extraction.

ailments.name: Middle third of the roots
ailments.notes: Moderate tooth loosening, percussion pain, occlusal pain, and tooth displacement in moderate level.

plans.notes: Take regular X-ray examination of pulp necrosis or root resorption: RCT.
Adjust occlusion adjustment and eliminate trauma.
Manual reduction and fixation under local anesthesia for 2-3 months.
Pay attention to oral hygiene: take soft food in about 2 weeks.

ailments.name: Apical third of the roots
ailments.notes: Slight tooth loosening, percussion pain, occlusal pain, and tooth displacement.

plans.notes: Have regular observation. Have crown RCT or apical resection or back filling on pulp necrosis.
If the tooth loosening is not obvious: reduction and fixation.
If the tooth loosening is obvious: full occlusal pad fixation.

ailments.name: Complete displacement
ailments.notes: Completely detached from the alveolar fossa, accompanied by fracture and gingival tear.

plans.notes: Displacement taken place within 30 minutes: implant the tooth.
Displacement taken place 2 hours ago and above: poor healing
Displacement taken place with 2 hours: Implant the tooth after external RCT and alveolar curettage.

ailments.name: Partial displacement
ailments.notes: Lateral displacement

plans.notes: Manual reduction under local anesthesia.
Ligation for four weeks.
RCT after two weeks.
Young permanent teeth cannot be forcibly restored.

sicknesss.name: Supernumerary teeth
sicknesss.notes: Also known as extra tooth. It refers to the extra tooth within the normal dentition range. It usually occurs in the permanent dentition and usually occurs between the upper central incisors.

plans.notes: If the tooth has not yet erupted but influence the adjacent tooth position or root development.
If the tooth has erupted: remove it
If the tooth has not yet erupted and has no influence on the adjacent tooth: have regular observations.

sicknesss.name: Impacted tooth
sicknesss.notes: It refers to the tooth that can only partially or can&#39;t erupt completely right now and in future due to the obstruction of adjacent teeth, bones, or soft tissues.

plans.notes: If the first and second molars are lost: reserve the tooth as abutment tooth or move forward the impacted tooth as replacement.
With symptoms: extract the tooth.
No symptoms: keep the tooth or extract it.

sicknesss.name: Pericoronitis
sicknesss.notes: Inflammation of soft tissue around the crown caused by incomplete eruption or impaction of wisdom teeth, which is commonly seen in 8-30 year people and can occur repeatedly. The patient feels swelling and pain in the posterior area of mandibular molars. The patient cannot chew and has swallowing pain. In severe cases, spontaneous jumping pain and mouth opening restriction occur.

plans.notes: Rinse and apply medicine.

ailments.name: Primary teeth medium caries
ailments.notes: Superfacial dentin caries

plans.notes: Glass ionomer cement filling
Composite resin filling

ailments.name: Medium caries
ailments.notes:
Caries to superficial dentin
1、Clinical symptoms: sensitive or painful to cold, hot, sweet or sour stimulation, but no continuous painful symptoms
2、Possibly lead to cavity: caries in interproximal area or groove, marginal ridge or groove&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;#39;s enamel turn black
3、Probing check: accessible to cavity, the cavity bottom is a bit soft, patients could be a bit sensitive to cavity inner wall check
4、For interproximal caries that is not easy to diagnose, possible to diagnose through bite wing film

plans.notes: Composite resin direct bonding restoration
CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration

sicknesss.name: Primary teeth deep caries
sicknesss.notes: Caries into the deep dentin, no exposure to the pulp

plans.notes: Indirect pulp capping + composite resin filling
Indirect pulp capping + preformed crown restoration
Indirect pulp capping+glass ionomer cement filling

ailments.name: Acute periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: Visibly large and deep cavity; no damage to dental tissues, possible dental shade change; possible vital pulp, obvious percussion pain, various degrees of tooth loosening, obvious bite pain, even possible soft tissue swelling pain

plans.notes: Root canal treatment + glass ionomer cement filling/composite resin filling/preformed crown restoration

ailments.name: Chronic periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: Visibly large and deep cavity; no damage to dental tissues, possible dental shade change; possible vital pulp, obvious percussion pain, various degrees of tooth loosening, various degrees of alveolar bone destruction and internal and external root resorption are noticed through X-ray check

plans.notes: Space retaining after extraction
Root canal treatment + glass ionomer cement filling/composite resin filling/preformed crown restoration

ailments.name: Primary teeth medium caries
ailments.notes: Superfacial dentin caries

plans.notes: Glass ionomer cement filling
Composite resin filling

ailments.name: Medium caries
ailments.notes:
Caries to superficial dentin
1、Clinical symptoms: sensitive or painful to cold, hot, sweet or sour stimulation, but no continuous painful symptoms
2、Possibly lead to cavity: caries in interproximal area or groove, marginal ridge or groove&amp;#39;s enamel turn black
3、Probing check: accessible to cavity, the cavity bottom is a bit soft, patients could be a bit sensitive to cavity inner wall check
4、For interproximal caries that is not easy to diagnose, possible to diagnose through bite wing film

plans.notes: Composite resin direct bonding restoration
CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration

sicknesss.name: Primary and permanent teeth medium caries

ailments.name: Primary teeth deep caries
ailments.notes: Caries into the deep dentin, no exposure to the pulp

plans.notes: Indirect pulp capping+glass ionomer cement filling
Indirect pulp capping + preformed crown restoration
Indirect pulp capping + composite resin filling

ailments.name: Deep caries
ailments.notes:
Caries into medium or deep dentin
1、Extremely sensitive to hot, cold, sweet or sour stimulants, or temporary pain for food impaction, but no spontaneous pain
2、Cavity is deep and close to the pulp. For caries under grooves, the cavity might not look big on the surface, but edges around it is considerably turning black, this indicates large impairment
3、Probing check could be adopted for cavity, cavity bottom reaches the medium or deep dentin, patients could be a bit sensitive to the probing check, but no penetration to the pulp
4、Bite wing film could display impairement, but usually smaller than the exact impairment area

plans.notes: Chairside CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration
Composite resin direct bonding restoration

sicknesss.name: Primary and permanent teeth deep caries

ailments.name: Secondary medium caries
ailments.notes:
For teeth with earlier filling treatment, there is further caries detected on the edges of the existing restoration or at the bottom, caries is into the superfacial dentin              
There is stain on the edges of the cavity, fissure is found between the filled materials and the cavity wall, it is soft and there is grey shadow between the filled materials and the cavity bottom through X-ray check

plans.notes: Chairside CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration
Composite resin direct bonding restoration

ailments.name: Secondary deep caries
ailments.notes: For teeth with earlier filling treatment, there is further caries detected on the edges of the existing restoration or at the bottom, caries is into the medium or deep dentin. There is stain on the edges of the cavity, fissure is found between the filled materials and the cavity wall, it is soft and there is grey shadow between the filled materials and the cavity bottom through X-ray check

plans.notes: Composite resin direct bonding restoration
Chairside CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration-as above

ailments.name: Acute serous periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: 1. At the initial stage, patients will feel mild pain or discomfort, numbness swelling, closed bite could make patients feel more comfortable; then there would be spontaneous dull pain, bite pain, teeth are felt to be floating up, bite will not ease the symptoms, but rather lead to fairly severe pain, affecting the food intake. Clinical time for serous period is very short and the pain will be limited to the tooth&amp;#39;s root, patients will be able to point out which tooth is impaired. 2. Caries, filling materials, other hard tissue disease, crown shade change or deep periodontal pocket could be found in the impaired teeth. 3. Impaired teeth lead to percussion pain（+）~（++）, possible I° movement. 4. Patients feel discomfort or pain when pressed on the apical position of the impaired tooth, there is no obvious swelling in the gum. 5. No response to the pulp vitality test, but premature permanent teeth or primary teeth&amp;#39;s inflamation could be spread to periapical areas before pulp necrosis, so patients could have response to the vitality test or even feel pain. 6. There is no obvious abnomal situation in the periapical tissues through X-ray check

plans.notes: 1. Incise and drain, and improve root canal treatment 2. Incise and drain and extract in the later period 3. Take antibacteria drugs and pain-killers

ailments.name: Acute suppurative periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: 1. Patients feel severe spontaneous pain and percussion pain, teeth loosen a lot, neighbouring teeth could loosen in the later stage and patients could feel the pain possibly, the surrounding soft tissues also will have inflammation. There are three clinical stages: 1)Apical abscess: impaired teeth bring spontaneous and continuous pain severely, percussion(++)~(+++), movement II°~III°, apical areas flushes and patients feel light pain if touched. 2) Abscess under periosteum: usually the impaired condition has been around 5 days , patients feel extreme pain, affecting sleep and eating: a. impaired teeth bring extreme continuous and pulsating pain, patients feel the impaired teeth are detached and loosened further, light touch of the impaired teeth could cause unbearable pain; b. Percussion pain(+++), movement II°~III°, apical areas flush and swell, patients feel pain if touched; c. Regional lymph nodes swell, patients feel pain if touched; lower jaw molars have mouth opening limitation, serious cases could involve relevant maxillofacial cellulitis; d. patients feel aches and pains all over the body, body temperature rises(usually lower than 38℃), white blood cell number increases. 3) Abscess under mucosa: impaired teeth bring less pain, mucosa around apical areas pop out in hemisphere, gums feel tender for palpation check, the whole body&amp;#39;s discomfort fades away a bit. 2. Deep cavity, filled materials, and other hard tissue diseases are visible in the impaired teeth, crown shades change and deep periodontal pockets appear, etc. 3. X-ray inspection shows that lamina dura disappears, periodontal membrane space widens, possible bone mineral density decreases, or no obvious change. If it is chronic periapical periodontitis patient, grey area of bone desctruction could be found in the X-ray check film

plans.notes: Incise and drain and extract in the later period 3. Take antibacteria drugs a
Incise and drain(incise to let out the pus depending on the specific situations), and optimize root canal treatment

sicknesss.name: Invasive periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: Rapid periodontal tissue damage, X-ray film shows vertical resorption on the mesial and distal sides of the first molar, incisors have horizontal bone resorption, possible impaired teeth are usually limited to first permanent molars or incisors, two permanent teeth at least will be affected, one tooth is first molar, number of non-first-molar and incisor teeth are no more than two

plans.notes: Maintaining treatment
Comprehensive treatment
Basic treatment
Medication-assisted treatment
Surgical treatment

ailments.name: Acute periodontal abscess
ailments.notes: Abrupt illness, oval or hemisphere shape of swelling appears on the gingiva, filled with blood; the pain in the initial stage is severe and pulsating, lack of biting force and discomfort is felt under percussion; the swelling eases up in the late stage of abscess. The surface becomes soft and tender, the pain lessens; deep periodontal pocket appears, there is purulent secretion inside, the swelling fades away after the abscess ulcerates; teeth loosen obviously; full body illness could be possible for some severe cases, white blood cell number increases, regional lymph nodes swell. X-ray check: severe alveolar bone resorption, possibly creating infrabony pocket

plans.notes: Supragingival scaling
Medication-assisted treatment
Incisional drainage
Oral hygiene instruction

ailments.name: Chronic periodontal abscess
ailments.notes: Caused by delayed treatment for acute periodontal abscess or recurrent illness; usually no obvious subjective symptoms, possible bite pain. A bit discomfort under percussion; acute abscess becomes chronic after ulceration, sinus entrance on the abscess surface, purulent secretion oozes out if pressed. X-ray check: medium and severe alveolar bone resorption and damage, sometimes root canal side perforation, vertical root fracture or root fracture of post-and-core and other causes could be found

plans.notes: Impaired teeth can not be kept, supragingival scaling needs to be done and teeth need to be extracted after abscess disappears
Impaired teeth could be kept, basic periodontal treatment is needed；

sicknesss.name: Combined periodontal-endodontic lesions
sicknesss.notes: Illness comes from pulp and/or periodontium, infection around teeth. Clinical symptoms are divided into three types: 1. comes from pulp: pulp infects apical foramen, lateral root canal leads to illness in the apical neighbouring tissues or furcation involvement, thus leading to periodontal-endodontic combined lesions; illness also appears in situations like root canal side perforation, vertical root fracture or pulp chamber floor perforation, pulp cavity or intracanal sealing. 2. comes from periodontium: typically it is retrograde pupititis, inflammation of the periodontal pocket could infect pulp through accessory root canal and/or apical foramen. 3. &amp;#34;Real combined lesions&amp;#34;: periodontal and pulp impairment happen to the same tooth, when the two impairments deteriorate, they could affect each other

plans.notes: Impaired teeth can not be kept: extract the teeth
Impaired teeth can be kept: 1. root canal treatment; 2. basic periodontal treatment, periodontal surgery to be considered depending on the situations

ailments.name: Non-physiological
ailments.notes: Teeth are subjected to external acid erosion and physical factors, the hard tissue is progressively lost

plans.notes: Treatment for the cause: adjust acid-loving eating habits, gargle after eating acid food, and regularly gargle with 3% baking soda solution. Improve production equipment to prevent air acid mist or acid anhydride concentration from being too high. Pay attention to precautions when using acidic drugs

Treatment for the cause: adjust acid-loving eating habits, gargle after eating acid food, and regularly gargle with 3% baking soda solution. Improve production equipment to prevent air acid mist or acid anhydride concentration from being too high. Pay attention to precautions when using acidic drugs

ailments.name: Physiological
ailments.notes: Self-secretion of the body destroys the acid-base balance of the oral cavity, and progressive loss of hard tissues occurs

plans.notes: Symptomatic treatment: Desensitizing treatment for tooth sensitivity; crown restoration after root canal treatment for pulpitis and periapical disease
Treatment for the cause: treat related systemic diseases and avoid aggressive tooth brushing

ailments.name: Mild
ailments.notes: The entire tooth&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;#39;s surface is yellow or gray, and evenly distributed, without banded staining

plans.notes: Symptomatic treatment: stained teeth can be treated with light-cured composite resin restorations, porcelain crown restorations, veneers or bleaching
Treatment for the cause: In order to prevent the occurrence of tetracycline teeth, pregnant and nursing women and children under 8 years old should avoid tetracycline drugs

ailments.name: Moderate
ailments.notes: Stained teeth range from brownish yellow to dark gray

plans.notes: Treatment for the cause: In order to prevent the occurrence of tetracycline staining of the teeth teeth, pregnant and nursing women and children under 8 years old should avoid tetracycline drugs。
Symptomatic treatment: stained teeth can be treated with light-cured composite resin restorations, porcelain crown restorations, veneers or bleaching

ailments.name: Severe
ailments.notes: Obvious banded staining can be seen on the tooth surface, the color range from yellow-gray to black

plans.notes: Treatment for the cause: In order to prevent the occurrence of tetracycline teeth, pregnant and nursing women and children under 8 years old should avoid tetracycline drugs
Symptomatic treatment: stained teeth can be treated with light-cured composite resin restorations, porcelain crown restorations, veneers or bleaching

ailments.name: Extremely severe
ailments.notes: The surface of the tooth is darkly stained, and in severe cases, it can be taupe

plans.notes: Symptomatic treatment: stained teeth can be treated with light-cured composite resin restorations, porcelain crown restorations, veneers or bleaching
Treatment for the cause: In order to prevent the occurrence of tetracycline teeth, pregnant and nursing women and children under 8 years old should avoid tetracycline drugs

sicknesss.name: Shallow caries
sicknesss.notes:
Generally asymptomatic
Chalky or tan tooth surface, which may be accompanied by a defect of superficial hard tissue
Superficial caries that occur in the enamel, the damage of enamel integrity can be felt during the examination, its surface is rough, and its hardness decreases
For unidentifiable adjacent caries, the X-ray transmission area of the enamel layer can be seen on the bitewing radiograph

plans.notes: Remineralization therapy
Chemotherapeutics- fluoride therapy

ailments.name: Sucking habitsSucking habits
ailments.notes: Most often seen in thumb-sucking, where the thumb is placed between the upper and lower front teeth, resulting in anterior protrusion of the upper front teeth, inward tilting of the lower front teeth and opening and closing of the front teeth, as well as contraction of the buccal muscles during sucking, narrowing of the upper dental arch, high arch of the palatal cover, elongation of the posterior teeth and rotation of the lower jaw downwards towards the back.

plans.notes:
Correction of bad habits: 1. Educate children to correct bad oral habits on their own.
 2. Blocking conditioned firing: wearing finger braces, applying bitter potions, etc

Wearing orthodontic appliances: oral vestibular shield + labial training.
movable orthoses with welded lip stoppers.
Lip stopper

ailments.name: Tongue licking habit
ailments.notes: The tongue licking habit is caused by the common use of the tongue to lick gaps in the dental arch, remnants of crowns and roots. When licking the upper front teeth, it causes the upper front teeth to tilt towards the lip, resulting in deep overlap and overlap of the front teeth; when licking the lower front teeth, it causes the lower front teeth to protrude forward, resulting in anticlinal teeth; if the upper and lower front teeth are licked at the same time, it causes the upper and lower front teeth to protrude forward, or it causes the double arch to protrude forward (commonly known as "whistling teeth"). The tongue is placed between the upper and lower front teeth during tongue licking. The pressure of the lingual muscles inhibits the growth of the upper anterior teeth, resulting in an open dentition with a pivot-shaped opening in the anterior region.

plans.notes: Correcting bad habits: teaching the correct way to move the tongue
Wearing orthodontic appliances: palatal spurs, lingual spurs orthodontic appliances

ailments.name: Abnormal lip habits
ailments.notes: Protrusion of the upper jaw and labial tilt of the upper front teeth: biting the lower lip and sucking the lower lip increase the force outside the lower jaw arch, which makes the lower jaw grow forward and increases the force outward of the upper jaw arch. The long-term effect can make the upper jaw protrude and the upper front teeth tilt labially, causing an abnormal relationship between the upper and lower jaws; protrusion of the lower jaw and inward tilt of the upper front teeth: biting the upper lip causes the lower jaw to protrude and the upper teeth to crowd and tilt towards the lingual side

plans.notes: Correcting bad habits: blocking abnormal lip movements
Wearing braces: functional braces, fixed braces, invisible braces

ailments.name: Mouth breathing habits
ailments.notes: Protrusion of the upper front teeth, facial narrowing, open lips and teeth, narrowing of the upper dental arch, high arches of the palatal lid and receding jaw deformity: the upper and lower lips open during mouth breathing and the air flows through the mouth. Long-term abnormal dynamics result in anterior protrusion of the upper front teeth, facial narrowing, open lips and teeth, narrowing of the upper dental arch, high arch of the palatal lid and receding mandibular deformity. The causes are commonly nasal airway obstruction or partial obstruction due to nasal tract abnormalities such as nasal tract narrowing, nasal septum deviation, nasal tract polyps, rhinitis, enlarged tonsils, etc. There are also cases of habitual mouth breathing with normal nasal tract

plans.notes: Correcting mouth breathing: For mouth breathing, the first step is to check for nasal obstruction and to prevent obstructive mouth breathing by actively treating rhinitis and other diseases
Wearing orthoses: In the absence of nasal obstruction, corrective treatment is available to correct the bad habit.

ailments.name: Nocturnal teeth grinding habit, deep overlap
ailments.notes: Digestive dysfunction, the child eats too much at night and when he falls asleep, a lot of food accumulates in his intestines and the gastrointestinal tract has to work overtime, because of the heavy burden, he will involuntarily grind his teeth when he sleeps. Unbalanced nutrition, some children are picky eaters, especially those who do not like vegetables, resulting in unbalanced nutrition, lack of calcium, phosphorus and various vitamins, unconscious contraction of the facial chewing muscles at night and teeth grinding back and forth. Poor dental growth and development, during tooth replacement, if the child suffers from rickets, malnutrition, congenital individual missing teeth, etc., when the upper and lower teeth come into contact, the teeth will be poorly developed and the biting  will be uneven.

plans.notes: Dinner should be light and not too full
In children who grind their teeth severely, to prevent grinding, jaw pads can be made and worn before the child goes to bed to reduce damage to normal teeth

ailments.name: Lateral chewing habits
ailments.notes: Facial asymmetry, skewed midline, unilateral retrognathism, deviated jaw deformity

plans.notes: General orthodontic treatment of established malocclusions
Early treatment of bad teeth, removal of coincidental interference and restoration of missing teeth
Change unilateral chewing habits

sicknesss.name: Deep Fissure
sicknesss.notes: The sulcus of each tooth has different shapes and depths, which is a suitable place for food residues to stay and bacteria to grow and reproduce. If the sulcus is very deep, then the bacteria will use the sugar in the residual food to reproduce and grow in the hidden narrow sulcus. The metabolic process produces acid which corrodes the teeth, causing the caries process, which is called a pit and fissure sealant

plans.notes: Fossa closure/sealant

sicknesss.name: Premature eruption of permanent teeth
sicknesss.notes: Deciduous molars have periapical lesions and root resorption; deciduous teeth exfoliate prematurely due to caries, pulp disease, periapical disease, periodontal disease, trauma, etc., and reduced eruption resistance of permanent teeth

plans.notes: Caries control
Control surrounding inflammation and facilitate the continued development of permanent teeth
Eruption blocking device

sicknesss.name: Hereditary dentin hypoplasia
sicknesss.notes: Clinically, it can be divided into three types. The most common is type II dentine dysplasia, also known as hereditary opalescent dentine dysplasia. The crown of the tooth is light blue to yellowish brown, and it is opalescent under light. The enamel is brittle and easily flaky, exposing the dentin, and thus the teeth are prone to wear and tear, leading to tooth breakage and periapical infection. In severe cases, obvious attrition throughout the dentition can be seen, leading to functional disorders with chewing and speech, and affecting the appearance of the teeth

plans.notes: Teeth with pulpitis or periapical inflammation should be treated with endodontics; to prevent the loss of tooth tissue due to wear and tear, full crown restoration can be selected, and removable dentures or occlusal pads can be used for restoration when necessary. Care should be taken to protect the affected tooth and reduce stress concentration during restoration. At the same time, patients should pay attention to control the bite force to prevent fracture of the affected teeth.

ailments.name: Abnormal number of teeth
ailments.notes: It is determined by genetics. When the teeth develop, it is caused by the lack of tooth buds; some congenital tooth loss is related to maternal disorders in the fetus, systemic or local diseases in infants and young children. It is often related to abnormal development of ectodermal leaves during human embryonic development; acquired environmental factors can also cause it. For example, if X-ray irradiation is performed in the early stage of tooth development, it can cause tooth loss on the irradiated side.

plans.notes: Wearing removable dentures (that is, dental prosthesis) is an effective means to solve this problem. Missing teeth can be partially filled with dentures, or the removable dentures can be covered on the real teeth for uneven teeth. If there are no teeth in the mouth, full dentures can be worn. . However, the facial jaw bone will continue to grow and develop before adulthood, and removable dentures must be replaced every two to three years, otherwise it will further damage the gums and cause pain.

sicknesss.name: Dens invaginatus
sicknesss.notes: Malformed lingual fossa, malformed root surface sulcus, malformed lingual cusp and dens in dente

plans.notes: If pulp and (or) periodontal disease has occurred, the method of further treatment should be selected according to the pulp state, root development and periodontal tissue involvement. For those who cause both pulp and periodontal diseases, periodontal surgery should be performed at the same time as root canal therapy
In the early stage, it should be treated as deep caries, and the softened tissue in the cavity should be removed to form a cavity, and it should be treated with indirect pulp capping

If the shape of the tooth is also abnormal, the affected tooth can be extracted and restored if necessary. If the fissure has reached the root tip, the periodontal tissue will be extensively damaged due to mutual interaction, the prognosis is poor and extraction is reccomended

ailments.name: Natal tooth
ailments.notes: Tooth erupted upon birth

plans.notes: Retain the tooth
For extremely loose teeth that may be eaten accidently, the teeth shall be extracted

ailments.name: Neonatal tooth
ailments.notes: Tooth erupted within 30 days after birth

plans.notes: Retain the tooth
For extremely loose teeth that may be eaten accidently, the teeth shall be extracted

sicknesss.name: Premature loss of primary teeth
sicknesss.notes: The deciduous teeth will be replaced by permanent teeth in a regular time. The deciduous teeth may fall off prematurely before the normal replacement time due to various reasons.

plans.notes: Lingual arch space maintainer
Removable functional maintainer
Filling single-arm space maintainer
Wear band or crown loop space maintainer
Nance maxillary spare maintainer

ailments.name: Very Mild
ailments.notes: Small, opaque, paper white areas scattered irregularly over the tooth but not involving as much as approximately 25% of the tooth surface. Frequently included in this classification are teeth showing no more than about 1 – 2mm of white opacity at the tip of the summit of the cusps, of the bicuspids or second molars.

plans.notes: Prevention: Limit the intake of excessive fluoride during the mineralization period of tooth development. The most ideal prevention method is to select the water source with appropriate fluoride content, or use activated alumina or activated carbon separately to remove excessive fluoride from the water source. But the latter method is expensive, thus not utilized. For those people living in areas with high fluoride, the water used should be processed especially for the special groups of pregnant women and children before the age of 8 . On the other hand, comprehensive nutrition should be provided for them with proper supplement of vitamin A, vitamin D and appropriate calcium and phosphorus, which can reduce the damage of fluoride to the body.

Treatment: For dental fluorosis without defect, the anterior teeth can be decolorized, and the posterior teeth can be left there without treatment; For fluoride teeth with substantial defects, composite resin can be used for repair.

ailments.name: Mild
ailments.notes: The white opaque areas in the enamel of the teeth are more extensive but do involve as much as 50% of the tooth.

plans.notes: Prevention: Limit the intake of excessive fluoride during the mineralization period of tooth development. The most ideal prevention method is to select the water source with appropriate fluoride content, or use activated alumina or activated carbon separately to remove excessive fluoride from the water source. But the latter method is expensive, thus not utilized. For those people living in areas with high fluoride, the water used should be processed especially for the special groups of pregnant women and children before the age of 8 . On the other hand, comprehensive nutrition should be provided for them with proper supplement of vitamin A, vitamin D and appropriate calcium and phosphorus, which can reduce the damage of fluoride to the body.

Treatment: For dental fluorosis without defect, the anterior teeth can be decolorized, and the posterior teeth can be left there without treatment; For fluoride teeth with substantial defects, composite resin can be used for repair. For those with severe defeats, veneers or full crown restoration can be applied.

ailments.name: Moderate
ailments.notes: All enamel surfaces of the teeth are affected and surfaces subject to attrition show wear. Brown stain is frequently a disfiguring feature.

plans.notes: Prevention: Limit the intake of excessive fluoride during the mineralization period of tooth development. The most ideal prevention method is to select the water source with appropriate fluoride content, or use activated alumina or activated carbon separately to remove excessive fluoride from the water source. But the latter method is expensive, thus not utilized. For those people living in areas with high fluoride, the water used should be processed especially for the special groups of pregnant women and children before the age of 8 . On the other hand, comprehensive nutrition should be provided for them with proper supplement of vitamin A, vitamin D and appropriate calcium and phosphorus, which can reduce the damage of fluoride to the body.

Treatment: For dental fluorosis without defect, the anterior teeth can be decolorized, and the posterior teeth can be left there without treatment; For fluoride teeth with substantial defects, composite resin can be used for repair. For those with severe defeats, veneers or full crown restoration can be applied.

ailments.name: Severe
ailments.notes: All enamel surfaces are affected and hypoplasia is so marked that the general form of the tooth may be affected. The major diagnostic sign of this classification is discrete or confluent pitting. Brown stains are widespread and teeth often present a corroded-like appearance.

plans.notes: Prevention: Limit the intake of excessive fluoride during the mineralization period of tooth development. The most ideal prevention method is to select the water source with appropriate fluoride content, or use activated alumina or activated carbon separately to remove excessive fluoride from the water source. But the latter method is expensive, thus not utilized. For those people living in areas with high fluoride, the water used should be processed especially for the special groups of pregnant women and children before the age of 8 . On the other hand, comprehensive nutrition should be provided for them with proper supplement of vitamin A, vitamin D and appropriate calcium and phosphorus, which can reduce the damage of fluoride to the body.

Treatment: For dental fluorosis without defect, the anterior teeth can be decolorized, and the posterior teeth can be left there without treatment; For fluoride teeth with substantial defects, composite resin can be used for repair. For those with severe defeats, veneers or full crown restoration can be applied.

ailments.name: Mild dental crowding
ailments.notes: Crowding ≤4mm

plans.notes: Expander (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)
Molars distalization (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)
Interproximal reduction (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)

ailments.name: Moderate dental crowding
ailments.notes: 4mm&lt;Crowding≤8mm

plans.notes: Interproximal reduction (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)
Expander (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)
Molars distalization (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)

ailments.name: Spacing
ailments.notes: Scattered gaps  between teeth due to bad oral habits or genetic reasons

plans.notes: Inlay/Onlay or crown
Orthdontics (Fixed treatment or aligner therapy)

ailments.name: Mild
ailments.notes: The enamel is not mineralized completely. The morphology is basically complete with changes only in the color and transparency, forming a chalky enamel. This is caused from poor mineralization and changes in refractive index. Generally there is no conscious symptom.

plans.notes: Prevention: The key people who should pay attention to enamel hypoplasia is pregnant women and children of 7 to 8 years old. Attention should be paid to have a comprehensive nutrition, avoiding the shortage of vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus. Pregnant women with endocrine disorders should be treated in time to avoid calcium and phosphorus disorders. In addition, deciduous tooth caries and periapical periodontitis should be treated as early as possible to avoid the impact on the development of permanent tooth germs.

ailments.name: Severe
ailments.notes:
Enamel formation is incomplete, and with substantial defect on the tooth surface, that is, brownish pits or grooves formed on the enamel surface.
①Horizontal grooves in the enamel surface: when enamel formation is impaired at same period simultaneously, horizontal grooves will be formed on the tooth. 
The width of the grooves can reflect the time horizon. If the impairing occurs repetitively, several horizontal grooves will appear.
②Pits in the enamel surface: It is caused by the destruction of ameloblasts in groups, while adjacent cells continue to survive and form enamel. In severe cases, the tooth surface is honeycombed.
③The incisor margin of the anterior teeth may become thinner, and the posterior cusp may defect or disappear. Since the pathogenic factors occur during tooth development which leads to enamel hypoplasia, the affected teeth are often symmetrical.

plans.notes: Treatment: These teeth are poorly mineralized and are likely to wear. The development of caries is rapid, affecting the function and aesthetics of the oral and chin system, and even affecting the mental health of adolescents. The main measures to be taken are: (1) have oral hygiene education, regular maintenance of oral hygiene, use of fluoride and desensitizing drugs to alleviate dental sensitivity symptoms, and prevention of caries and periodontal disease; and (2) have early diagnosis and preventive treatment to prevent wear and secondary lesion; (3) have repair plan (all ceramic crown or veneer) according to the degree of tooth coloring and defect to control infection and restore beauty and functions; (4) have permanent fixed repair after complete stability of maxillofacial development.

Prevention: The key people who should pay attention to enamel hypoplasia is pregnant women and children of 7 to 8 years old. Attention should be paid to have a comprehensive nutrition, avoiding the shortage of vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus. Pregnant women with endocrine disorders should be treated in time to avoid calcium and phosphorus disorders. In addition, deciduous tooth caries and periapical periodontitis should be treated as early as possible to avoid the impact on the development of permanent tooth germs.

sicknesss.name: Дефект зубов
sicknesss.notes: Неполная морфология зуба, вызванная кариесом, травмой, стиранием, кислотной эрозией и т.д.

plans.notes: Пломбировка или рестоврация зубов.

ailments.name: Кариес зубов - Поверхностный кариес
ailments.notes: Кариес ограничивается эмалью, как правило, без явных полостей, без симптомов, без реакции на осмотр.

plans.notes: Улучшите гигиену полости рта, и может потребоваться пломбирование кариеса.

ailments.name: Кариес зубов - Умеренный кариес
ailments.notes: Кариес достиг поверхностного слоя дентина, обычно с полостями, и может иметь симптомы чувствительности к внешним раздражителям.

plans.notes: Своевременное заполнение кариеса.
Улучшите гигиену полости рта и вовремя устраните кариес.

ailments.name: Кариес зубов - Глубокий кариес
ailments.notes: Кариес достиг глубокого слоя дентина с более глубокими полостями, и реакция на внешние раздражители (такие как холодные, горячие, сладкие, кислотные раздражители и принятие пищи) тяжелее, чем при умеренном кариесе.

plans.notes: Улучшите гигиену полости рта и вовремя устраните кариес.

sicknesss.name: Кариес зубов
sicknesss.notes: Кариес также называют разрушением зубов. Первоначальное появление - это белые пятна или желтовато-коричневые пятна на поверхности зубов, а также дальнейшее развитие кариеса и чувствительности зубов.

sicknesss.name: Сросшийся зуб
sicknesss.notes: Сращивание зубов возникает в результате соединения двух нормально разделенных зубных зародышей из-за определенной степени стимуляции.

plans.notes: Удаление зубов или восстановительное лечение.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов - Нормальное
ailments.notes: Зубная дуга выглядит правильной и симметричной.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов -Скученность
ailments.notes: Скученность зубов - наиболее распространенный неправильный прикус. Это может быть выражено в виде смещения зубов.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов-Расстояние между зубами
ailments.notes: Очевидный промежуток между зубами.

plans.notes: Расположение зубов связано с множеством факторов, таких как генетика и привычки. Рекомендуется соблюдать правила гигиены полости рта и регулярно осматривать полость рта.
Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов -Перекрёстный прикус
ailments.notes: Его можно разделить на перекрестный прикус с одним зубом и перекрестный прикус с несколькими зубами. Перекрестный прикус - это состояние зубов, которое влияет на то, как расположены ваши зубы. Основным признаком перекрестного прикуса является то, что верхние зубы прилегают к нижним зубам, когда ваш рот закрыт или находится в состоянии покоя.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов - Открытый прикус
ailments.notes: Открытый прикус - это тип неправильного прикуса, который в основном характеризуется вертикальным промежутком. Этот промежуток обычно виден, когда зубы двух челюстей полностью соприкасаются.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов - Перекрёстный прикус
ailments.notes: Перекрестный прикус определяется как щечное смещение заднего зуба верхней челюсти с контактом или без контакта между язычной поверхностью язычного выступа верхней челюсти и щечной поверхностью щечного выступа антагониста нижней челюсти.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Выравнивание зубов - Глубокий прикус
ailments.notes: Относится к степени вертикального (верхнего-нижнего) перекрытия центральных резцов верхней челюсти над центральными резцами нижней челюсти, это неправильный прикус более 2-3 мм.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment- с тенденцией к открытому nприкусу
ailments.notes: С тенденцией к открытому прикусу- это степень горизонтального (передне-заднего) перекрытия центральных резцов верхней челюсти над центральными резцами нижней челюсти, это превышение более чем на 2-3 мм.

plans.notes: Для лечения можно использовать съемный ортодонтический аппарат, элайнеры или фиксированный ортодонтический аппарат.

sicknesss.name: Выравнивание зубов
sicknesss.notes: Нормальный зубной ряд имеет правильный и аккуратный внешний вид, каждый зуб имеет свое определенное положение в альвеолярной кости, а зубы плотно прилегают друг к другу; неправильное расположение зубов повлияет на внешний вид лица, процесс жевания, произношение и другие функции.

sicknesss.name: Зубной камень
sicknesss.notes: Кальцифицированный зубной налет и мягкие отложения на поверхности зубов могут выглядеть от желтовато-белого до коричневато-черного цвета.

plans.notes: улучшите гигиену полости рта и выполните удаление зубного камня.

sicknesss.name: Деформированный зуб
sicknesss.notes: Деформация центрального выступа; деформация язычного выступа; деформированная язычная ямка и инвагинатус - все это деформации зубов.

plans.notes: Удаление зубов или восстановительное лечение.

sicknesss.name: Пигментация зубов
sicknesss.notes: Пища, табак, чай, кофе и т.д. Прилипают к поверхности зубов, на которых появляются желтые или черные пятна, некоторые из них также вызваны препаратами тетрациклина, которые делают зубы серыми, желтыми или коричневыми.

plans.notes: Улучшите привычки гигиены полости рта и выполните проф гигиену полости рта.

sicknesss.name: Гингивит
sicknesss.notes: Гингивит - это воспаление десен, вызванное накоплением зубного налета на краю десен, которое может проявляться в виде красных и опухших десен и кровоточивости десен.

plans.notes: Улучшите привычки гигиены полости рта и выполните проф гигиену полости рта.

sicknesss.name: Потеря зубов
sicknesss.notes: Широко известный как отсутствующие зубы. Отсутствие зубов повлияет на нормальное употребление пищи, произношение и эстетику.

plans.notes: Реставрационное лечение зубов.

ailments.name: Хронический периодонтит
ailments.notes: Вызвано зубным налетом, зубным камнем, травмой и другими факторами, проявляющимися в виде отека и кровоточивости десен, неприятного запаха изо рта, опущения десен или даже их расшатывания.

plans.notes: Улучшите гигиену полости рта и проведите системное лечение пародонта.

ailments.name: Агрессивный периодонтит
ailments.notes: Это часто встречается у здоровых молодых людей с быстрым прогрессированием заболевания и генетической предрасположенностью.

plans.notes: Улучшите гигиену полости рта и проведите системное лечение пародонта.

ailments.name: Периодонтит, вызванный системными заболеваниями
ailments.notes: Диабет, СПИД и т.д. могут усугубить воспаление пародонта.

plans.notes: Улучшить гигиену полости рта, проводить системное лечение пародонта и активно лечить системные заболевания.
Улучшите гигиену полости рта и проведите системное лечение пародонта.

sicknesss.name: Периодонтит
sicknesss.notes: Хроническое воспаление тканей пародонта, вызванное зубным налетом, зубным камнем, травмой и другими факторами.

sicknesss.name: Неправильный прикус
sicknesss.notes: Неправильный прикус относится к неправильному соотношению между зубами, зубной дугой, челюстью и черепно-лицевым положением.

plans.notes: Некоторые привычки являются причиной некоторых деформаций зубов и челюстей, называемых вредными привычками полости рта. К распространенным из них относятся привычки сосать пальцы, плохие привычки языка, плохие привычки губ и т.д., Которые следует преодолеть как можно скорее. Если неправильный прикус уже имеет место, как можно скорее обратитесь к врачу.

sicknesss.name: Здоровые зубы
sicknesss.notes: Стандарты гигиены полости рта, установленные Всемирной организацией здравоохранения: 1. Зубы чистые, 2. Отсутствие кариеса, 3. Отсутствие боли, 4. Нормальный цвет десен, 5. Отсутствие кровотечения.

plans.notes: Соблюдайте правила гигиены полости рта и регулярно проводите осмотры полости рта.

sicknesss.name: Fehlkontakten der Zähne
sicknesss.notes: Unter Fehlkontakten der Zähne versteht man die irreguläre Anordnung der Zähne, des Zahnbogens, des Kiefers und der kraniofazialen Position.

plans.notes: Lösung: Bestimmte Angewohnheiten sind die Ursache für einige Zahn- und Kieferdeformationen, die als schlechte Angewohnheiten bezeichnet werden. Zu den üblichen Gewohnheiten gehören das Lutschen an den Fingern, die schlechte Zunge, die schlechten Lippen usw., die so schnell wie möglich überwunden werden sollten. Wenn bereits eine Zahnfehlstellung vorliegt, sollten Sie so schnell wie möglich einen Arzt aufsuchen.

sicknesss.name: Zahnstein
sicknesss.notes: Der verkalkte Zahnbelag und die weichen Ablagerungen auf der Oberfläche der Zähne können gelblich-weiß bis bräunlich-schwarz erscheinen.

plans.notes: Lösung: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten und führen Sie eine Zahnsteinentfernung durch.

sicknesss.name: Fehlgebildeter Zahn
sicknesss.notes: Zentrale Höckerdeformität, linguale Höckerdeformität, fehlgebildete Fossa lingualis und Dens invaginatus sind alles Zahndeformitäten.

plans.notes: Zahnextraktion oder restaurative Behandlung.

sicknesss.name: Gesunde Zähne
sicknesss.notes: Die Standards für Zahngesundheit der Weltgesundheitsorganisation: 1. Zahnreinigung, 2. keine Karies, 3. keine Schmerzen, 4. normale Zahnfleischfarbe, 5. keine Blutungen.

plans.notes: Lösung: Achten Sie auf eine gute Mundhygiene und führen Sie regelmäßig Kontrolluntersuchungen durch.

ailments.name: Chronische Parodontitis
ailments.notes: Verursacht durch Zahnbelag, Zahnstein, Traumata und andere Faktoren, die sich in Form von Schwellungen und Blutungen des Zahnfleischs, Mundgeruch, Zahnfleischrückgang oder sogar Zahnlockerung äußern.

plans.notes: Verbesserung der Mundhygienegewohnheiten und systemische Parodontalbehandlung.

ailments.name: Aggressive Parodontitis
ailments.notes: Die Krankheit tritt häufig bei jungen, gesunden Menschen auf, schreitet schnell voran und tritt familiär gehäuft auf.

plans.notes: Verbesserung der Mundhygienegewohnheiten und systemische Parodontalbehandlung.
Verbesserung der Mundhygienegewohnheiten und systemische Parodontalbehandlung.

ailments.name: Parodontitis aufgrund von systemischen Erkrankungen
ailments.notes: Diabetes, AIDS usw. können eine parodontale Entzündung verschlimmern.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie die Mundhygiene, führen Sie eine systemische Parodontalbehandlung durch und behandeln Sie aktiv systemische Erkrankungen.

sicknesss.name: Parodontitis
sicknesss.notes: Chronische Entzündung des Parodontalgewebes, verursacht durch Zahnbelag, Zahnstein, Trauma und andere Faktoren.

sicknesss.name: Geschmolzener Zahn
sicknesss.notes: Die Zahnverschmelzung entsteht durch die Vereinigung von zwei normalerweise getrennten Zahnkeimen aufgrund einer bestimmten Stimulation.

plans.notes: Zahnextraktion oder restaurative Behandlung.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - normal
ailments.notes: Der Zahnbogen wird als gleichmäßig und symmetrisch dargestellt.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder festsitzende kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Überfüllung
ailments.notes: Engstehende Zähne sind die häufigste Malokklusion. Sie kann als Zahnfehlstellung dargestellt werden.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Zahnlücken
ailments.notes: Offensichtliche Lücken zwischen den Zähnen.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Kreuzbiss
ailments.notes: Er kann in Einzelzahn-Kreuzbiss und Mehrzahn-Kreuzbiss unterteilt werden. Der Kreuzbiss ist ein zahnmedizinischer Zustand, der die Ausrichtung der Zähne beeinträchtigt. Das wichtigste Anzeichen für einen Kreuzbiss ist, dass die oberen Zähne bei geschlossenem Mund oder im Ruhezustand hinter die unteren Zähne passen.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Offener Biss
ailments.notes: Der offene Biss ist eine Art von Fehlstellung, die vor allem durch eine vertikale Zahnlücke gekennzeichnet ist. Diese Lücke ist in der Regel sichtbar, wenn die Zähne der beiden Kiefer vollständig in Kontakt sind.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Scherengebiss
ailments.notes: Ein Scherenbiss ist definiert als bukkale Verschiebung eines Oberkieferseitenzahns mit oder ohne Kontakt zwischen der lingualen Oberfläche des Oberkieferseitenzahns und der bukkalen Oberfläche des bukkalen Höckers des Unterkieferantagonisten.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Überbiss
ailments.notes: Es handelt sich um einen Überbiss von mehr als 2-3 mm, der sich auf das Ausmaß der vertikalen (superior-inferioren) Überlappung der zentralen Oberkieferschneidezähne über die zentralen Unterkieferschneidezähne bezieht.

plans.notes: Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder festsitzende kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

ailments.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne - Overjet
ailments.notes: Overjet ist das Ausmaß der horizontalen (anterior-posterioren) Überlappung der zentralen Oberkieferschneidezähne über die zentralen Unterkieferschneidezähne, wobei der Overjet mehr als 2-3 mm beträgt.

plans.notes: Die Zahnanordnung hängt von mehreren Faktoren ab, wie z. B. der Genetik und den Mundgewohnheiten. Es wird empfohlen, gute Mundhygienegewohnheiten zu pflegen und regelmäßige Kontrolluntersuchungen vorzunehmen.
Für die Behandlung können herausnehmbare kieferorthopädische Apparate, unsichtbare Schienen oder feste kieferorthopädische Apparate verwendet werden.

sicknesss.name: Ausrichtung der Zähne
sicknesss.notes: Ein gesundes Gebiss hat ein gleichmäßiges und ordentliches Aussehen, jeder Zahn hat seine spezifische Position im Kieferknochen, und die Zähne liegen eng beieinander; eine abnorme Zahnanordnung beeinträchtigt das Aussehen des Gesichts, das Kauen, die Aussprache und andere Funktionen.

sicknesss.name: Zahnfleischentzündung (Gingivitis)
sicknesss.notes: Gingivitis ist eine Entzündung des Zahnfleischs, die durch die Ansammlung von Plaque am Zahnfleischrand verursacht wird und sich durch rotes und geschwollenes Zahnfleisch sowie Zahnfleischbluten äußern kann.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten und führen Sie eine parodontale Zahnsteinentfernung durch.

sicknesss.name: Fehlende Zähne
sicknesss.notes: Fehlende Zähne beeinträchtigen das normale Essen, die Aussprache und die Ästhetik.

plans.notes: Behandlung von Zahnrestaurationen.

ailments.name: Zahnkaries - Oberflächliche Karies
ailments.notes: Karies ist auf den Zahnschmelz beschränkt, im Allgemeinen keine offensichtlichen Hohlräume, keine Symptome, keine Reaktion auf die Untersuchung.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten, und es kann eine Kariesfüllung erforderlich sein.

ailments.name: Zahnkaries-Moderate Karies
ailments.notes: Karies hat die oberflächliche Schicht des Dentins erreicht, in der Regel mit Hohlräumen, und kann Symptome der Empfindlichkeit gegenüber äußeren Reizen aufweisen.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten und füllen Sie Karies rechtzeitig auf.
Rechtzeitige Kariesauffüllung.

ailments.name: Zahnkaries-Tiefe Karies
ailments.notes: Die Karies hat die tiefe Schicht des Dentins erreicht, mit tieferen Kavitäten, und die Reaktion auf äußere Reize (wie Kälte, Hitze, Süße, saure Reize und Nahrungsaufnahme) ist stärker als bei moderater Karies.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten und füllen Sie Karies rechtzeitig auf.

sicknesss.name: Karies
sicknesss.notes: Karies wird auch als Zahnfäule bezeichnet. Das anfängliche Symptom sind weiße oder gelblich-braune Flecken auf der Oberfläche der Zähne, und die weitere Entwicklung von Karies und Zahnempfindlichkeit.

sicknesss.name: Mängel an den Zähnen
sicknesss.notes: Unvollständige Zahnmorphologie aufgrund von Karies, Trauma, Abrasion, Säureerosion usw.

plans.notes: Füllungsbehandlung oder Restaurationsbehandlung.

sicknesss.name: Pigmentierung der Zähne
sicknesss.notes: Essen, Tabak, Tee, Kaffee usw. lagern sich an der Oberfläche der Zähne an, die gelb oder schwarz verfärbt erscheinen, einige werden auch durch Tetrazyklin-Medikamente verursacht, die die Zähne grau, gelb oder braun färben.

plans.notes: Verbessern Sie Ihre Mundhygienegewohnheiten und führen Sie eine Zahnreinigungsbehandlung durch.

sicknesss.name: 融和牙
sicknesss.notes: 融合牙是一種畸形牙齒，一般是在兩個牙胚發育期間，相鄰的牙胚之間受到了一定的刺激，兩個牙胚就長在並一起萌出。

plans.notes: 可拔除或進行修復治療。

sicknesss.name: 牙齒缺損
sicknesss.notes: 由齲齒、外傷、磨損、酸蝕等造成的牙齒形態的不完整。

plans.notes: 及時進行充填治療或修復治療。

sicknesss.name: 牙齦發炎
sicknesss.notes: 牙齦炎是牙齦邊緣牙菌斑堆積造成的牙齦炎症，可表現為牙齦紅腫、牙齦出血。

plans.notes: 改善口腔衛生習慣，可進行牙周清潔（俗稱洗牙）。

sicknesss.name: 健康的牙齒
sicknesss.notes: 世界衛生組織制定的牙齒健康標準：1、牙齒清潔，2、無齲洞，3、無疼痛感，4、牙齦顏色正常，5、無出血現象。

plans.notes: 保持良好的口腔衛生習慣，定期進行口腔檢查。

sicknesss.name: 牙結石
sicknesss.notes: 沉積在牙齒表面已鈣化的牙菌斑及軟垢，牙齒表面會呈現黃白色至棕黑色。

plans.notes: 改善口腔衛生習慣，可進行牙周清潔（俗稱洗牙）。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-正常
ailments.notes: 牙弓形態規則且對稱。

plans.notes: 保持良好的口腔衛生習慣，定期進行口腔檢查。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-擁擠
ailments.notes: 牙列擁擠是最常見的錯咬畸形，可表現為牙齒擁擠錯位排列不齊。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-間隙
ailments.notes: 牙齒之間存在明顯間隙。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-錯咬或反咬
ailments.notes: 分為單牙反咬和多牙反咬，多牙反咬俗稱“地包天”，通常表現為下牙包往上牙。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-開咬
ailments.notes: 指正常咬合時上下頜部分牙齒在垂直向無接觸。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-切咬
ailments.notes: 切咬在臨床上可分為正切和反切。正切是指上頜後牙舌側咬頭位於下頜後牙頰側咬頭的頰側，正常咬合面無咬合接觸，臨床較為多見；反切是指上頜後牙頰側咬頭的位於下頜後牙舌側咬頭的舌側，咬合面多無咬合接觸，臨床上較少見。正反切可發生於單側或者雙側，最常見於上下頜第二大臼齒，前牙區的切咬也較常發生。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-深咬
ailments.notes: 指上牙包住下牙的範圍超過了2～3毫米。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。
牙齒排列情況與遺傳、口腔習慣等多因素有關，建議保持良好的口腔衛生習慣，定期進行口腔檢查。

ailments.name: 牙齒排列情況-暴牙
ailments.notes: 是指上前牙切端至下前牙唇面的最大水平距離超過2-3毫米，也就是上頜前牙比下頜前牙向前突超過2-3毫米。

plans.notes: 可進行活動矯正器、隱形牙套或固定矯正器治療。

sicknesss.name: 牙齒排列情況
sicknesss.notes: 正常牙列外形規則、整齊，每個牙在牙槽骨內有其特定的位置，牙與牙之間緊密鄰接；牙齒排列異常會對面部美觀、咀嚼、發音等功能產生不同程度的影響。

ailments.name: 慢性牙周炎
ailments.notes: 由牙菌斑、牙結石、創傷等因素造成，表現為牙齦紅腫出血、口臭、牙齦退縮甚至鬆動。

plans.notes: 建議改善口腔衛生習慣，進行系統性牙周治療。
建議改善口腔衛生習慣，進行系統性牙周治療。

ailments.name: 侵襲性牙周炎
ailments.notes: 常發生於全身健康的年輕人，疾病進展快速、有家族聚集性。

plans.notes: 建議改善口腔衛生習慣，進行系統性牙周治療。

ailments.name: 全身疾病導致的牙周炎
ailments.notes: 糖尿病、艾滋病等可加重牙周炎症。

plans.notes: 建議改善口腔衛生習慣，進行系統性牙周治療，積極治療全身性疾病。

sicknesss.name: 牙周炎
sicknesss.notes: 由牙菌斑、牙結石、創傷等因素造成的牙周組織的慢性炎症。

sicknesss.name: 牙齒缺失
sicknesss.notes: 俗稱缺牙，牙齒缺失後會影響到正常的飲食、發音及美觀，建議及時修復。

plans.notes: 及時進行牙齒修復治療。

sicknesss.name: 牙齒色素附著
sicknesss.notes: 飲食、煙茶咖啡等附著於牙齒表面形成的黃或黑色斑塊，或者四環素等藥物造成的牙齒呈灰、黃或棕色。

plans.notes: 改善口腔衛生習慣，必要時可洗牙去除色素。

ailments.name: 齲病-淺齲
ailments.notes: 齲壞限於釉質，一般無明顯齲洞，無自覺症狀，探查也無反應。

plans.notes: 及時進行齲齒充填，俗稱補牙。
改善口腔衛生習慣，可能需要進行齲齒充填（俗稱補牙）。

ailments.name: 齲病-中齲
ailments.notes: 齲壞達到牙本質，有明顯齲洞，對外界刺激有敏感症狀。

plans.notes: 改善口腔衛生習慣，並儘快進行齲齒充填（俗稱補牙）。

ailments.name: 齲病-深齲
ailments.notes: 一般表現為大而深的齲洞，對外界刺激(如冷、熱、甜、酸和食物嵌入等)反應較重。

plans.notes: 改善口腔衛生習慣，可能需要進行齲齒充填（俗稱補牙）。

sicknesss.name: 齲齒
sicknesss.notes: 齲齒俗稱蛀牙，初期表現為牙齒表面有白色斑塊或黃褐色斑塊，進一步發展會形成齲洞並出現牙齒敏感。

sicknesss.name: 畸形牙
sicknesss.notes: 畸形中央尖、畸形舌側窩、畸形舌側尖、牙中牙，同屬於牙齒形態畸形。

plans.notes: 可拔除或進行修復治療。

sicknesss.name: 咬合不正
sicknesss.notes: 指牙齒、牙弓、頜骨和顱面位置相互間的關係不協調。

plans.notes: 某些習慣動作是造成一些牙頜畸形的原因,稱之為口腔不良習慣,常見的有吮指習慣、不良舌習慣、不良唇習慣等，應儘早克服；如果已經出現錯頜畸形表現，建議盡快就醫。

ailments.name: Periodontitis crónica
ailments.notes: Provocada por placa dental, cálculos, traumatismos y otros factores, que se manifiestan como hinchazón y sangrado de las encías, mal aliento, retracción de las encías o incluso aflojamiento.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un tratamiento periodontal completo.
Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un tratamiento periodontal completo.

ailments.name: Periodontitis agresiva
ailments.notes: Suele ocurrir en jóvenes que generalmente tienen hábitos sanos, con una progresión rápida de la enfermedad y en grupos familiares.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un tratamiento periodontal completo.

ailments.name: Periodontitis causada por enfermedades sistémicas
ailments.notes: Enfermedades como diabetes, SIDA, etc. pueden agravar la inflamación periodontal.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un tratamiento periodontal completo.

sicknesss.name: Periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: Inflamación crónica del tejido periodontal causada por placa dental, cálculos, traumatismos y otros factores.

sicknesss.name: Anomalía dentaria
sicknesss.notes: Morfología dental incompleta causada por caries, trauma, abrasión, erosión ácida, etc.

plans.notes: Tratamiento de relleno o tratamiento de restauración.

sicknesss.name: Pérdida de dientes
sicknesss.notes: También conocido como ausencia de dientes. La falta de dientes puede afectar la alimentación, la pronunciación y la estética.

plans.notes: Solución:Tratamiento de restauración dental.

sicknesss.name: Diente malformado
sicknesss.notes: La deformidad de la cúspide central; la deformidad de la cúspide lingual; la fosa lingual malformada y dens invaginatus son todas deformidades dentales.

plans.notes: Extracción dental o tratamiento restaurador.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes- Normal
ailments.notes: El arco dental se manifiesta como regular y simétrico.

plans.notes: para realizar el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Apiñamiento
ailments.notes: El apiñamiento de los dientes es la maloclusión más común. Puede manifestarse como una desalineación de los dientes.

plans.notes: para realizar el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes- Espaciado
ailments.notes: Espacio obvio entre los dientes.

plans.notes: para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Mordida cruzada
ailments.notes: La mordida cruzada puede ocurrir en un solo diente o en varios dientes. La mordida cruzada es una condición dental que afecta la forma en que se alinean los dientes. El principal signo de tener una mordida cruzada es que los dientes superiores encajan detrás de los dientes inferiores cuando la boca está cerrada o en reposo.

plans.notes: para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Mordida abierta.
ailments.notes: La mordida abierta es un tipo de maloclusión que se caracteriza principalmente por un espacio vertical. Este espacio suele ser visible cuando los dientes de las dos mandíbulas están completamente en contacto.

plans.notes: para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Mordida en tijera
ailments.notes: Una mordida en tijera se define como el desplazamiento bucal de un diente posterior superior con o sin contacto entre la superficie lingual de la cúspide lingual del maxilar y la superficie bucal de la cúspide bucal del antagonista mandibular.

plans.notes: La disposición de los dientes está relacionada con múltiples factores como la genética y los hábitos bucales. Se recomienda mantener buenos hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar revisiones periódicas.
para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Sobremordida
ailments.notes: Consulte la extensión de la superposición vertical (superior-inferior) de los incisivos centrales superiores sobre los incisivos centrales mandibulares, es una sobremordida de más de 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

ailments.name: Alineamiento de los dientes - Resalte incisal
ailments.notes: El resalte incisal es la extensión de la superposición horizontal (anterior-posterior) de los incisivos centrales superiores sobre los incisivos centrales inferiores, es un resalte de más de 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: para el tratamiento se pueden usar aparatos de ortodoncia removibles, alineadores invisibles o aparatos de ortodoncia fijos.

sicknesss.name: Alineamiento de los dientes
sicknesss.notes: La dentición normal tiene una apariencia regular y prolija, cada diente tiene su posición específica en el hueso alveolar y los dientes están muy cerca unos de otros; la disposición anormal de los dientes afectará la apariencia facial, la masticación, la pronunciación y otras funciones

sicknesss.name: Gingivitis
sicknesss.notes: La gingivitis es la inflamación de las encías provocada por la acumulación de placa en el borde de estas, que puede manifestarse como encías rojas e hinchadas y encías sangrantes.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar raspado periodontal.

sicknesss.name: Maloclusión
sicknesss.notes: La maloclusión se refiere a la relación irregular entre los dientes, el arco dental, la mandíbula y la posición craneofacial.

plans.notes: Los llamados malos hábitos orales son la causa de algunas deformidades dentales y mandibulares. Los más comunes son los hábitos de chuparse los dedos, malos hábitos con respecto a la lengua, malos hábitos con respecto a los labios, etc., que deben superarse lo antes posible. Si ya se presenta una maloclusión, busque atención médica lo antes posible.

sicknesss.name: Calculo dental o sarro
sicknesss.notes: La placa bacteriana y los depósitos blandos en la superficie de los dientes pueden aparecer de color blanco amarillento a negro pardusco

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un raspado de encías.

sicknesss.name: Dientes saludables
sicknesss.notes: Los estándares de salud de la cavidad oral establecidos por la Organización Mundial de la Salud son: 1. Dientes limpios, 2. Sin caries, 3. Sin dolor, 4. El color de la encía es normal, 5. Sin sangrado.

plans.notes: Solución: Mantener hábitos adecuados de higiene bucodental Y realizar controles regulares¨.

sicknesss.name: Diente fusionado
sicknesss.notes: La fusión dental surge a través de la unión de dos gérmenes dentarios normalmente separados debido a una cierta cantidad de estimulación.

plans.notes: Extracción dental o tratamiento restaurador.

sicknesss.name: Pigmentación de los dientes
sicknesss.notes: Los alimentos, el tabaco, el té, el café, etc. se adhieren a la superficie de los dientes y se tiñen de amarillo o negro, además las tetraciclinas hacen que los dientes se tiñan grises, amarillos o marrones.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y realizar un tratamiento periodontal.

ailments.name: Caries dentales – caries superficiales
ailments.notes: Las caries se limitan al esmalte, generalmente sin cavidades evidentes, sin síntomas, sin respuesta a la exploración.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y si es necesario, el relleno de caries dentales.
Rellenar las cavidades que provocan las caries a tiempo.

ailments.name: Caries dentales - Caries de etapa moderada
ailments.notes: La caries llegan a la capa superficial de la dentina, generalmente provocando cavidades, y pueden ser sensibles a los estímulos externos.

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y rellenar las cavidades a tiempo.

ailments.name: Caries dentales-Caries profundas
ailments.notes: La caries llegan a la capa profunda de la dentina, provocando cavidades más profundas, y una respuesta más intensa a los estímulos externos (como el frío, el calor, lo dulce, los estímulos ácidos y la inserción de alimentos) que la caries en etapa moderada

plans.notes: Mejorar los hábitos de higiene bucal y rellenar las cavidades a tiempo.

sicknesss.name: Caries
