sicknesss.notes: Las caries también son llamadas caries dentales. La apariencia inicial en la superficie de los dientes es de manchas blancas o manchas de color marrón amarillento, y luego se produce el desarrollo de caries y sensibilidad dental.

sicknesss.name: Perte de dents
sicknesss.notes: Communément connu sous le nom de dents manquantes. Les dents manquantes affecteront l&#39;alimentation, la prononciation et l&#39;esthétique.

plans.notes: Traitement de restauration dentaire.

sicknesss.name: Dents défectueuses
sicknesss.notes: Morphologie dentaire incomplète causée par des caries, un traumatisme, une abrasion, une érosion acide, etc.

plans.notes: Traitement de comblement ou traitement de restauration.

sicknesss.name: Gingivite
sicknesss.notes: La gingivite est une inflammation des gencives causée par l&#39;accumulation de plaque sur le bord des gencives, qui peut se manifester par des gencives rouges et enflées et des saignements des gencives.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un détartrage parodontal.

ailments.name: Caries dentaires-Caries superficielles
ailments.notes: La carie est limitée à l&#39;émail, généralement pas de caries évidentes, pas de symptômes, pas de réponse à l&#39;exploration.

plans.notes: les caries se remplissent dans le temps.
Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et le remplissage des caries dentaires peut être nécessaire.

ailments.name: Caries dentaires-Caries modérées
ailments.notes: Les caries ont atteint la couche superficielle de la dentine, généralement avec des caries, et peuvent présenter des symptômes de sensibilité aux stimuli externes.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et combler les caries dentaires à temps.

ailments.name: Caries dentaires-Caries profondes
ailments.notes: Les caries ont atteint la couche profonde de la dentine, avec des cavités plus profondes, et la réponse aux stimuli externes (comme le froid, le chaud, le sucré, les stimuli acides et l&#39;insertion d&#39;aliments) est plus lourde que les caries modérées.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et combler les caries dentaires à temps.

sicknesss.name: Caries
sicknesss.notes: La carie est aussi appelée carie dentaire. L&#39;apparition initiale est des taches blanches ou des taches brun jaunâtre sur la surface des dents, et le développement ultérieur de la carie et de la sensibilité dentaire.

ailments.name: Parodontite chronique
ailments.notes: Causé par la plaque dentaire, le tartre, un traumatisme et d&#39;autres facteurs, se manifestant par un gonflement et un saignement des gencives, une mauvaise haleine, un déchaussement des gencives ou même un relâchement.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un traitement parodontal systémique.

ailments.name: Parodontite agressive
ailments.notes: Il survient souvent chez les jeunes en bonne santé, avec une progression rapide de la maladie et des grappes familiales.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un traitement parodontal systémique.

ailments.name: Parodontite causée par des maladies systémiques
ailments.notes: Le diabète, le SIDA, etc. peuvent aggraver l&#39;inflammation parodontale.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un traitement parodontal systémique.
Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire, effectuer un traitement parodontal systémique et traiter activement les maladies systémiques.

sicknesss.name: Parodontite
sicknesss.notes: Inflammation chronique du tissu parodontal causée par la plaque dentaire, le calcul, les traumatismes et d&#39;autres facteurs.

sicknesss.name: Dent fusionnée
sicknesss.notes: La fusion dentaire résulte de l&#39;union de deux germes dentaires normalement séparés en raison d&#39;une certaine stimulation.

plans.notes: Extraction de dents ou traitement de restauration.

sicknesss.name: Dent mal formée
sicknesss.notes: Difformité de la cuspide centrale ; déformation de la cuspide linguale ; fosse linguale malformée et dens invaginatus sont toutes des déformations dentaires.

plans.notes: Extraction de dents ou traitement de restauration.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-Normal
ailments.notes: L&#39;arcade dentaire se manifeste comme régulière et symétrique.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-Chevauchement
ailments.notes: L&#39;encombrement des dents est la malocclusion la plus courante. Cela peut se traduire par un mauvais alignement des dents.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-Espacement
ailments.notes: Espace évident entre les dents.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-occlusion croisée
ailments.notes: Il peut être divisé en occlusion croisée à une seule dent et en occlusion croisée à plusieurs dents. L&#39;occlusion croisée est une condition dentaire qui affecte la façon dont vos dents sont alignées. Le principal signe d&#39;occlusion croisée est que les dents supérieures s&#39;insèrent derrière votre dents du bas lorsque la bouche est fermée ou au repos.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents - occlusion ouverte
ailments.notes: La béance est un type de malocclusion qui se caractérise principalement par un espace vertical. Cet espace est généralement visible lorsque les dents des deux mâchoires sont complètement en contact.

plans.notes: La disposition des dents est liée à de multiples facteurs tels que la génétique et les habitudes bucco-dentaires. Il est recommandé de maintenir de bonnes habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et d&#39;effectuer des inspections bucco-dentaires régulières.
Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-occlusion en ciseaux
ailments.notes: Un articulé en ciseaux est défini comme un déplacement vestibulaire d&#39;une dent postérieure maxillaire avec ou sans contact entre la surface linguale de la cuspide linguale maxillaire et la surface buccale de la cuspide buccale de l&#39;antagoniste mandibulaire.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-Overbite
ailments.notes: Reportez-vous à l&#39;étendue du chevauchement vertical (supérieur-inférieur) des incisives centrales maxillaires sur les incisives centrales mandibulaires, il s&#39;agit d&#39;une surocclusion supérieure à 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

ailments.name: Alignement des dents-Overjet
ailments.notes: Le surplomb est l&#39;étendue du chevauchement horizontal (antéro-postérieur) des incisives centrales maxillaires sur les incisives centrales mandibulaires, il est surplombé de plus de 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: Un appareil orthodontique amovible, des gouttières invisibles ou un appareil orthodontique fixe peuvent être utilisés pour le traitement.

sicknesss.name: Alignement des dents
sicknesss.notes: La dentition normale a une apparence régulière et soignée, chaque dent a sa position spécifique dans l&#39;os alvéolaire et les dents sont étroitement adjacentes les unes aux autres ; une disposition anormale des dents affectera l&#39;apparence du visage, la mastication, la prononciation et d&#39;autres fonctions.

sicknesss.name: Pigmentation des dents
sicknesss.notes: La nourriture, le tabac, le thé, le café, etc. sont attachés à la surface des dents qui apparaissent des taches jaunes ou noires, certains sont également causés par des médicaments à base de tétracycline, qui rendent les dents grises, jaunes ou brunes.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un détartrage parodontal.

sicknesss.name: Malocclusion
sicknesss.notes: La malocclusion fait référence à la relation irrégulière entre les dents, l&#39;arcade dentaire, la mâchoire et la position craniofaciale.

plans.notes: certaines habitudes sont à l&#39;origine de certaines déformations dentaires et de la mâchoire, appelées mauvaises habitudes orales. Les plus courantes sont les habitudes de succion des doigts, les mauvaises habitudes de la langue, les mauvaises habitudes des lèvres, etc., qui doivent être surmontées dès que possible. Si une malocclusion se produit déjà, consultez un médecin dès que possible.

sicknesss.name: Tartre dentaire
sicknesss.notes: La plaque dentaire calcifiée et les dépôts mous à la surface des dents peuvent apparaître blanc jaunâtre à noir brunâtre.

plans.notes: Améliorer les habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et effectuer un détartrage parodontal.

sicknesss.name: Des dents saines
sicknesss.notes: Normes de santé dentaire établies par l&#39;Organisation mondiale de la santé : 1. Dents propres, 2. Aucune carie, 3. Aucune douleur, 4. Couleur normale des gencives, 5. Aucun saignement.

plans.notes: Maintenir de bonnes habitudes d&#39;hygiène bucco-dentaire et faire des inspections bucco-dentaires régulières.

ailments.name: 치아 카리에스 - 표재성 카리에스
ailments.notes: 카리에스가 법랑질에 국한되며 일반적으로 명백한 충치가 없고 증상이 없으며 탐색에 대한 반응이 없습니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 치아 카리에스 충전이 필요할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 카리에스 - 중등도 카리에스
ailments.notes: 카리에스가 일반적으로 충치가 있는 상아질의 표층에 도달했으며 외부 자극에 민감한 증상을 보일 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 제때 치아 카리에스를 채웁니다.

ailments.name: 치아 카리에스 –심각한 카리에스
ailments.notes: 카리에스가 더 깊은 충치가 있는 상아질의 깊은 층에 도달했으며 외부 자극(예: 찬 것, 뜨거운 것, 단맛, 산성 자극 및 음식물)에 대한 반응은 중등도의 카리에스보다 심합니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 제때 치아 카리에스를 채웁니다.
적시 카리에스 충전.

sicknesss.name: 카리에스
sicknesss.notes: 카리에스는 충치라고도 합니다. 초기 모습은 치아 표면에 흰색 반점 또는 황갈색 반점이며, 카리에스와 치아 민감도가 추가로 발달합니다.

sicknesss.name: 치아 결함
sicknesss.notes: 충치, 외상, 찰과상, 산성 침식 등으로 인한 불완전한 치아 형태

plans.notes: 충전 처리 또는 수복 처리.

ailments.name: 만성 치주염
ailments.notes: 치태, 치석, 외상 및 기타 요인으로 인해 잇몸이 붓고 출혈이 생기며 구취, 잇몸이 물러나거나 느슨해지기까지 합니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 전신적인 치주 치료를 시행합니다.

ailments.name: 공격적인 치주염
ailments.notes: 빠른 질병 진행과 가족 내에서 건강한 젊은 사람들에게서 자주 발생합니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 전신적인 치주 치료를 시행합니다.
구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 전신적인 치주 치료를 수행합니다.

ailments.name: 전신질환으로 인한 치주염
ailments.notes: 당뇨병, AIDS 등은 치주 염증을 악화시킬 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 전신 치주 치료를 수행하며 전신 질환을 적극적으로 치료합니다.

sicknesss.name: 치주염
sicknesss.notes: 치태, 치석, 외상 및 기타 요인으로 인한 치주 조직의 만성 염증.

sicknesss.name: 건강한 치아
sicknesss.notes: 세계보건기구(WHO)에서 제정한 치과 건강 기준: 1. 깨끗한 치아, 2. 충치 없음, 3. 통증 없음, 4. 정상적인 잇몸색, 5. 출혈 없음.

plans.notes: 올바른 구강 위생 습관을 유지하고 정기적인 구강 검사를 받으십시오.

sicknesss.name: 쌍생치
sicknesss.notes: 치아 융합은 일정량의 자극에 의해 정상적으로 분리된 두 개의 치아 세균이 결합하여 발생합니다.

plans.notes: 치아 발치 또는 수복 치료.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 - 정상
ailments.notes: 치열궁이 규칙적이고 대칭적으로 나타납니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 - 총생
ailments.notes: 치아 총생은 가장 흔한 부정교합입니다. 치아의 부정교합으로 나타날 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬-이개
ailments.notes: 치아 사이의 명백한 간격.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 - 교차 교합
ailments.notes: 단일 치아 교차 교합과 여러 치아 교차 교합으로 나눌 수 있습니다. 교차 교합은 치아가 정렬되는 방식에 영향을 미치는 치과 질환입니다. 교차교합의 주요 징후는 입을 다물거나 쉬고 있을 때 윗니가 아랫니 뒤에 맞춰지는 것입니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 - 개방 교합
ailments.notes: 개방 교합은 주로 수직 간격이 특징인 부정교합의 한 유형입니다. 이 간격은 일반적으로 두 턱의 치아가 완전히 접촉할 때 볼 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 - 가위 교합
ailments.notes: 가위 교합은 위턱 설측 교두의 설면과 아래턱 대합 협측 교두의 협측 표면 사이에 접촉이 있거나 없는 위턱 구치의 협측 변위로 정의됩니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬 – 피개 교합
ailments.notes: 위턱 중절치와 아래턱 중절치가 수직(상하) 겹치는 정도를 말하며, 2~3mm 이상 피개 교합입니다.

plans.notes: 치아 배열은 유전과 구강 습관과 같은 여러 요인과 관련이 있습니다. 올바른 구강 위생 습관을 유지하고 정기적인 구강 검사를 받는 것이 좋습니다.
가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

ailments.name: 치아 정렬-오버젯
ailments.notes: 오버젯은 위턱 중절치가 아래턱 중절치에 수평(전후) 중첩되는 정도이며, 2-3mm 이상 오버젯입니다.

plans.notes: 가철식 교정 장치, 보이지 않는 교정 장치 또는 고정 교정 장치를 사용하여 치료할 수 있습니다.

sicknesss.name: 치아 정렬
sicknesss.notes: 정상적인 치열은 규칙적이고 깔끔한 외관을 가지며 각 치아는 치조골에서 특정 위치를 가지며 치아는 서로 밀접하게 인접합니다. 비정상적인 치아 배열은 얼굴 모양, 저작, 발음 및 기타 기능에 영향을 미칩니다.

sicknesss.name: 치석
sicknesss.notes: 석회화된 치태와 치아 표면의 부드러운 침전물은 황백색에서 갈색을 띤 검정색으로 나타날 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 치주 스케일링을 시행합니다.

sicknesss.name: 치은염
sicknesss.notes: 치은염은 잇몸 가장자리에 플라그가 축적되어 잇몸에 염증이 생기는 것으로 잇몸이 붉어지고 부어 오르고 잇몸에서 피가 나는 증상이 나타날 수 있습니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 치주 스케일링을 시행합니다.

sicknesss.name: 치아 상실
sicknesss.notes: 일반적으로 빠진 치아로 알려져 있습니다. 치아가 없으면 정상적인 식사, 발음 및 미관에 영향을 미칩니다.

plans.notes: 치아 수복 치료.

sicknesss.name: 기형 치아
sicknesss.notes: 중심 교두 변형; 설측 교두 변형; 기형 설측와 및 중적치(치내치) 모두 치아 기형입니다.

plans.notes: 치아 발치 또는 수복 치료.

sicknesss.name: 부정교합
sicknesss.notes: 부정교합은 치아, 치열궁, 턱 및 두개안면의 위치 사이의 불규칙한 관계를 말합니다.

plans.notes: 일부 습관은 구강 나쁜 습관이라고 하는 일부 치아 및 턱 기형의 원인입니다. 흔한 습관으로는 손가락 빠는 습관, 나쁜 혀 습관, 나쁜 입술 습관 등이 있으며 이를 빨리 극복해야 합니다. 부정교합이 이미 발생한 경우 가능한 한 빨리 의사의 진료를 받으십시오.

sicknesss.name: 치아의 착색
sicknesss.notes: 음식, 담배, 차, 커피 등이 치아 표면에 부착되어 노란색 또는 검은색으로 변색되며 일부는 치아를 회색, 노란색 또는 갈색으로 만드는 테트라사이클린 약물에 의해 발생하기도 합니다.

plans.notes: 구강 위생 습관을 개선하고 치주 스케일링을 수행합니다.

ailments.name: Carie dentali-Carie superficiali
ailments.notes: La carie è limitata allo smalto, in generale nessuna cavità evidente, nessun sintomo, nessuna risposta all'esplorazione.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale; potrebbe essere necessario rimuovere le tracce di tessuto carioso superficiale.

ailments.name: Carie dentale-Carie moderata
ailments.notes: La carie ha raggiunto lo strato superficiale della dentina, solitamente con cavità, e può presentare sintomi di sensibilità agli stimoli esterni.

plans.notes: Rimuovere il tessuto carioso e otturare la cavita il prima possibile.
migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale e rimuovere le tracce di tessuto carioso superficiale il prima possibile.

ailments.name: Carie dentale-Carie profonde
ailments.notes: La carie ha raggiunto lo strato profondo della dentina, con cavità più profonde, e la risposta agli stimoli esterni (come stimoli freddi, caldi, dolci, acidi e residui di cibo) è più grave della carie moderata.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale e rimuovere le tracce di tessuto carioso superficiale il prima possibile.

sicknesss.name: Carie
sicknesss.notes: L'aspetto iniziale è costituito da macchie bianche o macchie bruno-giallastre sulla superficie dei denti e dall'ulteriore sviluppo della carie e della sensibilità dei denti.

sicknesss.name: Malformazione dentale
sicknesss.notes: Deformità della cuspide centrale; deformità della cuspide linguale; fossa linguale malformata e dens invaginatus sono tutte deformità dei denti.

plans.notes: estrazione dei denti o trattamento restaurativo.

sicknesss.name: Denti danneggiati
sicknesss.notes: Morfologia dentale incompleta causata da carie, traumi, abrasioni, erosioni acide, ecc.

plans.notes: Trattamento odontoiatrico restaurativo.

sicknesss.name: Tartaro dentale
sicknesss.notes: La placca dentale calcificata e i depositi morbidi sulla superficie dei denti possono apparire da bianco giallastro a nero-brunastro.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire la levigatura parodontale.

sicknesss.name: Gengivite
sicknesss.notes: La gengivite è un'infiammazione delle gengive causata dall'accumulo di placca sul bordo delle gengive, che può manifestarsi con gengive arrossate e gonfie o sanguinanti.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia sottogengivale.

sicknesss.name: Salute dentale
sicknesss.notes: Standard di salute dentale stabiliti dall'Organizzazione Mondiale della Sanità: 1. Pulizia dei denti, 2. Nessuna carie, 3. Nessun dolore, 4. Colore gengivale normale, 5. Nessun sanguinamento.

plans.notes: mantenere buone abitudini di igiene orale e sottoporsi a regolari ispezioni orali.

ailments.name: Parodontite cronica
ailments.notes: Causato da placca dentale, tartaro, traumi e altri fattori, che si manifestano come gonfiore e sanguinamento delle gengive, alitosi, recessione gengivale o allentamento.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia sottogengivale.

ailments.name: Parodontite aggressiva
ailments.notes: Si verifica spesso nei giovani sani, con una rapida progressione della malattia e cluster familiari.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia sottogengivale.
migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia sottogengivale.

ailments.name: Parodontite causata da malattie sistemiche
ailments.notes: Diabete, AIDS, ecc. possono aggravare l'infiammazione parodontale.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia sottogengivale, trattare attivamente le malattie sistemiche.

sicknesss.name: Parodontite
sicknesss.notes: Infiammazione cronica del tessuto parodontale causata da placca dentale, tartaro, traumi e altri fattori.

sicknesss.name: Pigmentazione dei denti
sicknesss.notes: Cibo, tabacco, tè, caffè, ecc. possono danneggiare la superficie dei denti che appaiono macchiati di giallo o nero, alcuni sono anche causati da farmaci, che rendono i denti grigi, gialli o marroni.

plans.notes: migliorare le abitudini di igiene orale ed eseguire una pulizia superficiale dello smalto e sottogengivale.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Normale
ailments.notes: L'arcata dentale si presenta come regolare e simmetrica.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Affollamento
ailments.notes: L'affollamento dei denti porta alla malocclusione più comune. Può presentarsi come disallineamento dei denti.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Spaziatura
ailments.notes: Evidente spazio tra i denti.

plans.notes: Soluzione: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

la disposizione dei denti è correlata a molteplici fattori come la genetica e le abitudini orali. Si raccomanda di mantenere buone abitudini di igiene orale e di sottoporsi a regolari ispezioni orali.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti - Morso crociato
ailments.notes: Può essere suddiviso in morso crociato parziale e morso incrociato completo. Il morso crociato è una condizione dentale che influisce sul modo in cui i denti sono allineati. Il principale segno di un morso crociato è che i denti superiori si adattano dietro i denti inferiori quando la bocca è chiusa o a riposo.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti: morso aperto
ailments.notes: Il morso aperto è un tipo di malocclusione caratterizzato principalmente da uno spazio vuoto verticale. Questo spazio è solitamente visibile quando i denti delle due arcate sono completamente in contatto.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Scissor bite
ailments.notes: Uno scissor bite è definito come lo spostamento vestibolare di un dente posteriore con o senza contatto tra la cuspide della superficie linguale e la superficie della cuspide vestibolare dell'antagonista.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Overbite
ailments.notes: Si riferisce all'estensione della sovrapposizione verticale (superiore-inferiore) degli incisivi centrali superiori sugli incisivi centrali inferiori, è considerato overbite da misure di 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

ailments.name: Allineamento dei denti-Overjet
ailments.notes: Si riferisce all'estensione della sovrapposizione orizzontale (anteriore-posteriore) degli incisivi centrali superiori sugli incisivi centrali inferiori, è considerato overjet da misure di 2-3 mm.

plans.notes: per il trattamento è possibile utilizzare apparecchi ortodontici rimovibili, allineatori invisibili o apparecchi ortodontici fissi.

sicknesss.name: Allineamento dei denti
sicknesss.notes: La dentatura normale ha un aspetto regolare e pulito, ogni dente ha la sua posizione specifica nell'osso alveolare e i denti sono strettamente adiacenti l'uno all'altro; la disposizione anormale dei denti influenzerà l'aspetto del viso, la masticazione, la pronuncia e altre funzioni.

sicknesss.name: Fusione dentale
sicknesss.notes: La fusione dei denti nasce dall'unione di due germi dentali normalmente separati.

plans.notes: estrazione dei denti o trattamento restaurativo.

sicknesss.name: Malocclusione dentale
sicknesss.notes: La malocclusione si riferisce alla relazione irregolare tra i denti, l'arcata dentale, la mascella e la posizione craniofacciale.

plans.notes: Sono molteplici le cause che determinano condizioni di malocclusione: si considerano infatti sempre come il risultato di una concomitanza di fattori genetici, anomalie di posizione della lingua a riposo e durante la deglutizione, anomalie respiratorie ed abitudini scorrette, che dovrebbero essere risolte il prima possibile. Se si verifica già una malocclusione, consultare un medico il prima possibile.

sicknesss.name: Perdita di denti
sicknesss.notes: Comunemente nota come mancanza di denti. questa influirà sulla normale alimentazione, pronuncia ed estetica.

plans.notes: Trattamento di odontoiatria restaurativa e protesica.

sicknesss.name: Malformed tooth
sicknesss.notes: Central cusp deformity ; lingual cusp deformity; malformed lingual fossa &amp;amp;amp;amp; dens invaginatus are all tooth deformities.

plans.notes: Teeth extraction or restorative treatment.

sicknesss.name: Teeth defect
sicknesss.notes: Incomplete tooth morphology caused by caries, trauma, abrasion, acid erosion, etc.

plans.notes: Filling treatment or restoration treatment.

sicknesss.name: Fused tooth
sicknesss.notes: Tooth fusion arises through union of two normally separated tooth germs due to a certain amount of stimulation.

plans.notes: Teeth extraction or restorative treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Normal
ailments.notes: Dental arch is manifested as regular &amp;amp;amp; symmetric.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.
The arrangement of teeth is related to multiple factors such as genetics and oral habits. It is recommended to maintain good oral hygiene habits and have regular oral inspections.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Crowding
ailments.notes: Teeth crowding is the most common malocclusion. It can be shown as teeth misalignment.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Spacing
ailments.notes: Obvious space between the teeth.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Cross bite
ailments.notes: It can be divided into single tooth cross bite and multiple teeth cross bite. Cross bite is a dental condition that affects the way your teeth are aligned. The main sign of having a cross bite is that upper teeth fit behind your lower teeth when your mouth is closed or at rest.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Open bite
ailments.notes: Open bite is a type of malocclusion that is majorly characterized by a vertical gap. This gap is usually visible when the teeth from the two jaws are completely in contact.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Scissor bite
ailments.notes: A scissor bite is defined as buccal displacement of a maxillary posterior tooth with or without contact between the lingual surface of maxillary lingual cusp and the buccal surface of the mandibular antagonist&amp;amp;#39;s buccal cusp.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Overbite
ailments.notes: Refer to the extent of vertical (superior-inferior) overlap of the maxillary central incisors over the mandibular central incisors, it is overbite more than 2-3mm.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

ailments.name: Teeth alignment-Overjet
ailments.notes: Overjet is the extent of horizontal (anterior-posterior) overlap of the maxillary central incisors over the mandibular central incisors, it is overjet more than 2-3mm.

plans.notes: Removable orthodontic appliance, invisible aligners or fixed orthodontic appliance can be used for treatment.

sicknesss.name: Teeth alignment
sicknesss.notes: Normal dentition has a regular and neat appearance, each tooth has its specific position in the alveolar bone, and the teeth are closely adjacent to each other; abnormal tooth arrangement will affect facial appearance, chewing, pronunciation and other functions.

sicknesss.name: Gingivitis
sicknesss.notes: Gingivitis is inflammation of the gums caused by the accumulation of plaque on the edge of the gums, which can be manifested as red and swollen gums and bleeding gums.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and perform periodontal scaling.

sicknesss.name: Dental calculus
sicknesss.notes: The calcified dental plaque and soft deposits on the surface of the teeth can appear yellowish-white to brownish-black.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and perform periodontal scaling.

sicknesss.name: Loss of teeth
sicknesss.notes: Commonly known as missing teeth. Missing teeth will affect normal eating, pronunciation and aesthetics.

plans.notes: Dental restoration treatment.

sicknesss.name: Healthy teeth
sicknesss.notes: Dental health standards established by the World Health Organization: 1. Teeth clean, 2. No cavities, 3. No pain, 4. Normal gum color, 5. No bleeding.

plans.notes: Maintain good oral hygiene habits and have regular oral inspections.

sicknesss.name: Malocclusion
sicknesss.notes: Malocclusion refers to the irregular relationship between the teeth, dental arch, jaw and craniofacial position.

plans.notes: Some habits are the cause of some dental and jaw deformities, called oral bad habits. The common ones include finger sucking habits, bad tongue habits, bad lip habits, etc., which should be overcome as soon as possible. If malocclusion already occurs, seek medical attention as soon as possible.

ailments.name: Chronic periodontitis
ailments.notes: Caused by dental plaque, calculus, trauma and other factors, manifested as swelling and bleeding of the gums, bad breath, receding gums or even loosening.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and perform systemic periodontal treatment.
Improve oral hygiene habits and perform systemic periodontal treatment.

ailments.name: Aggressive periodontitis
ailments.notes: It often occurs in young people who are healthy, with rapid disease progression and familial clusters.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and perform systemic periodontal treatment.

ailments.name: Periodontitis caused by systemic diseases
ailments.notes: Diabetes, AIDS, etc. can aggravate periodontal inflammation.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits, perform systemic periodontal treatment, and actively treat systemic diseases.

sicknesss.name: Periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: Chronic inflammation of periodontal tissue caused by dental plaque, calculus, trauma and other factors.

ailments.name: Dental caries-Superficial caries
ailments.notes: Caries is limited to enamel, generally no obvious cavities, no symptoms, no response to exploration.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and dental caries filling may be required.

ailments.name: Dental caries-Moderate caries
ailments.notes: Caries have reached the superficial layer of dentin, usually with cavities, and may have symptoms of sensitivity to external stimuli.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and fill dental caries in time.
Caries filling in time.

ailments.name: Dental caries-Deep caries
ailments.notes: Caries have reached the deep layer of dentin, with deeper cavities, and the response to external stimuli (such as cold, hot, sweet, acid stimuli and food insertion) is heavier than moderate caries.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and fill dental caries in time.

sicknesss.name: Caries
sicknesss.notes: Caries is also called tooth decay. The initial appearance is white patches or yellowish brown patches on the surface of the teeth, and the further development of caries and tooth sensitivity.

sicknesss.name: Pigmentation of teeth
sicknesss.notes: Food, tobacco, tea, coffee, etc. are attached to the surface of the teeth which appear yellow or black staining, some are also caused by tetracycline drugs, which make the teeth gray, yellow or brown.

plans.notes: Improve oral hygiene habits and perform periodontal scaling.

sicknesss.name: Tooth concussion
sicknesss.notes: Slight loosening and percussion pain

plans.notes: Lower the bite and fix the loose teeth
Regular review at 1,3,6 and 12 months
The pulp was discolored and necrotic with no response ：Root canal therapy

ailments.name: Unexposed pulp
ailments.notes: Enamel - dentin fracture

plans.notes: Pulp capping, Resin composite restoration
Regular observation
Fixation
Occlusal adjustment
Fractured crown bonding

ailments.name: Exposed pulp
ailments.notes: Pain triggered by hot and cold ,tenderness

plans.notes: Preserve the pulp as much as possible ，promote closure of root apex
Apexification or RCT

ailments.name: Cervical third
ailments.notes: Obvious loosening of tooth, percussion pain, pain when biting, tooth displacement

plans.notes: Root is not developed: RCT after Apexification
Root is too short: extraction
Crown-root ratio is coordinated: reposition and fixation
Root development is complete: RCT

ailments.name: Middle third
ailments.notes: There are signs of  loosening of tooth, percussion pain, pain when biting, tooth displacement，but not serious

plans.notes: Pay attention to oral hygiene: a soft food diet for about 2 weeks
Local anesthesia for reposition and fixation for 2-3 months
Periodic review of X-ray for pulp necrosis or root resorption
Adjust occlusion, erase trauma

ailments.name: Apical third
ailments.notes: loosening of tooth, percussion pain, pain on biting, tooth displacement are mild and not obvious

plans.notes: Obvious loosening: fix with dental splinting
Little loosening: reposition and fixation
Regular inspections

ailments.name: Total luxation
ailments.notes: Completely luxated out of its socket, associated with bone fracture, gingival laceration

plans.notes: Poor healing over 2 hours
Reimplantaion within 30 minutes
Ex vivo RCT in 2 hours + reimplantaion after alveolar curettage

ailments.name: Subluxation
ailments.notes: Lateral luxation

plans.notes: Stabilize the tooth for 4 weeks
RCT in 2 weeks
Reposition under local anesthesia
Young permanent teeth cannot be forcibly repositioned

sicknesss.name: Low frenum
sicknesss.notes: Gaps between the central incisors, which affects the retention of the denture

plans.notes: Low frenum: Frenectomy under local anesthesia, interrupted suture
Hypertrophy of labial frenum: Wedge incision between incisors that reaches the palate papilla

sicknesss.name: Ankyloglossia
sicknesss.notes: It forms a difficult to roll the tongue, which affects pronunciation

plans.notes: Cut the frenulum under local anesthesia until the disappears when protruding the tongue, and suture longitudinally

sicknesss.name: Bone protuberance, bone spur
sicknesss.notes: Sharp bone protuberance  bone spur before restoration

plans.notes: Trim and flatten protuberance spur after incision and flap operation under local anesthesia

sicknesss.name: Pericoronitis
sicknesss.notes: Inflammation of the soft tissue around the crown caused by incomplete or impacted wisdom teeth eruption. It is common between the ages of 8 and 30 and can occur repeatedly. Conscious swelling and pain in the mandibular retromolar area, unable to chew, pain on swallowing, spontaneous throbbing pain and limited mouth opening in severe cases

plans.notes: Rinse and apply medicine

sicknesss.name: Dry Socket
sicknesss.notes: Severe throbbing pain for 2-3 days after tooth extraction, and spread to the auriculotemporal, submandibular region or the top of the head, The tooth extraction socket is empty, or there are corrupt and necrotic residual blood clots with foul smell. The whole body may have a low-grade fever, and general analgesics cannot effectively relieve pain

plans.notes: Use 3% hydrogen peroxide cotton to scrub the bone wall of the extraction socket to completely remove the putrefaction under local anesthesia, rinse with normal saline and fill with iodoform gauze, take analgesic and antibacterial drugs and remove the iodoform gauze after 10 days

sicknesss.name: Impacted tooth
sicknesss.notes: Tooth that fails to erupt into the dental arch due to obstruction by adjacent teeth, bone, or soft tissue, and cannot erupt in the future

plans.notes: Missing the first second molars: Reserved for preparation or moving forward for substitution
Tooth that fails to erupt into the dental arch due to obstruction by adjacent teeth, bone, or soft tissue, and cannot erupt in the future
Having symptoms: extraction

sicknesss.name: Supernumerary teeth
sicknesss.notes: A supernumerary tooth is one that is additional to the normal dentition and usually occurs in the permanent dentition, most supernumerary teeth are located in the maxillary central incisors

plans.notes: Tooth has erupted: extraction
Not erupted and affecting the position of adjacent teeth or root development: extraction
Not erupted and no effect on adjacent teeth: observation

sicknesss.name: Dentin Hypersensitivity
sicknesss.notes: 1. Pain and soreness during mechanical stimulation, and the pain disappears immediately after the stimulation is removed, or complicated with pain to cold, hot, sour, sweet stimulation, no spontaneous pain. 2 Sensitive point can be found when examining the tooth with a probe, usually in the exposed part of the dentin, at the junction of the enamel and dentin 3.Often accompanied by dental disease that causes exposure of dentin, such as wear, Wedge-shaped defect, or crown fracture 4. Patient may have a systemic background of increased irritability such as neurosis, pregnancy and menstruation

plans.notes: 1. Remove the cause 2. Desensitization 3. Filling 4. Adjust occlusion 5. Root canal therapy crown restoration

sicknesss.name: Wedge-shaped defect
sicknesss.notes: 1. Cervical hard tissue defect, Can appear as varying degrees of wedge-shape; papilionaceous, deep and narrow groove. more common on the labial and buccal side, but also on the lingual side 2. The defect surface is smooth and hard, generally not stained 3. There may be no symptoms or tooth sensitivity, caries, secondary pulpitis, periapical periodontitis

plans.notes: 1. Remove the cause, correct the way of brushing and eating habits, adjust occlusion 2. Symptomatic treatment: desensitization, filling, root canal treatment of dental crown restoration

sicknesss.name: Cracked tooth
sicknesss.notes: 1. Molars and premolars of middle-aged and elderly people have a history of prolonged chewing pain; cold and hot stimulation pain . They may also have a history of painful bite at a specific site or bite injury 2. The occlusal crack merges with the developmental groove and extends across the marginal crest 3.Deep staining occurs after applying iodine tincture, shadow wisp deep into the tooth can be seen in projection examination. Generally the tooth with the same name occurs symmetrically 4. Occlusal surface of  affected tooth often have abnormal wear and high-steep cusps, with lateral percussion pain and pain when biting 5. There is often pigmentation in crack place , which may cause secondary caries, pulp congestion, pulpitis, pulp necrosis, and periapical periodontitis

plans.notes: 4.RCT full crown restoration
5.Improve unilateral chewing: Treat contralateral teeth, restore missing teeth
3.Fill with resin
1.Adjust the antagonist
6.Extraction
2.Close the crack

ailments.name: Bone resorption phase i-ii
ailments.notes: Mild to moderate horizontal absorption with individual vertical bone loss, probing depth. =5mm

ailments.name: Mild
ailments.notes: Inadequate enamel mineralization, where the enamel morphology is basically intact, with only changes in colour and transparency, forming chalky enamel. This is caused by poor mineralization and changes in refractive index, usually consult without symptoms

plans.notes: Prevention: The key group for prevention. of enamel hypoplasia are pregnancies and children age before 7~8, who should pay attention to comprehensive nutrition and prevent deficiencies of vitamin A, C, calcium and phosphorus. Pregnancies with endocrine disorders should be treated promptly to avoid calcium and phosphorus disorders. In addition, early treatment of caries in milk teeth and periapical infection should be carried out to avoid the influence on permanent teeth embryos

ailments.name: Severe
ailments.notes:
Incomplete enamel formation with substantial defects on tooth surface, ie: brown depressions in the from of bands and ligatures on the surface of tooth enamel
①Banded (cross- grooved) defects: Banded defects can be formed on the tooth surface when the enamel formation suffers a full-scale disorder during the same period
The width of band can reflect the duration of the disorder. If the disorders occur repeatedly, several bands of depressions will appear
②Ligature defects: caused by the destruction of enamel cell forming in groups while the others survive and form enamels. In severe cases, tooth surface form honeycomb structure
③There may be thinning of incisal edge of anterior teeth and loss of cusp of posterior teeth. Since the causative factor only occur during tooth development to cause enamel hypoplasia, the affected teeth tend to be symmetrical

plans.notes: Prevention: The key group of prevention of enamel hypoplasia are pregnancies and children age before 7~8, who should pay attention to comprehensive nutrition and prevent deficiencies of vitamin A, C, calcium and phosphorus. Pregnancies with endocrine disorders should be treated promptly to avoid calcium and phosphorus disorders. In addition, early treatment of caries in milk teeth and periapical infection should be carried out to avoid the influence on permanent teeth embryos

ailments.name: Non-physiological
ailments.notes: Self-secretion destroys the oral acid-base balance, progressive loss of hard tissues occurs.

plans.notes: Teatment for the cause: Treat related systemic diseases and avoid violent tooth brushing.
Symptomatic treatment: filling after desensitization for tooth sensitivity; crown restoration after root canal treatment for pulpitis and periapical disease.

ailments.name: Physiologic
ailments.notes: The tooth is eroded by external acid and physical factors, and the hard tissue is progressively lost.

plans.notes: Treatment for the cause: Adjust acid-loving eating habits, gargle after acid food, and regularly gargle with 3% baking soda solution. Improve production equipment to prevent air acid mist or acid anhydride concentration from being too high. Precautions for the use of acidic drugs.
Symptomatic treatment: Filling after desensitization for tooth sensitivity; crown restoration after root canal treatment for pulpitis and periapical disease.

ailments.name: Raptured, fractured, perforated restoration
ailments.notes: ①Material resistance does not have enough support force, glass ceramic has a higher fraction rate, resin is low in strength, fractured part will normally take place where the thinnest part exist. Manufactured procedure, force will be centred into the surface with edge, improper sandblasting, crack on ceramic restoration, improper binding between PFM and ceramic, etc. They all will cause perforated or fractured ceramic.

plans.notes:
You can use HF acid for 1-2 minutes and blowed using silicon to fix anterior all ceramic crown or PFM partially fractured
Using coupling agent at the fractured part with light-cured complex resins to fix. Also can drain small holes to fix the ceramic, increasing the volume of resin material. You would need to redo when the fractured or perforated part is large.

ailments.name: Restoration with insufficient retention

plans.notes: Can remove excess cement and do normal procedure, using high quality material to re-cement.

sicknesss.name: Hypodontia
sicknesss.notes: Hypodontia may happen in either baby teeth or permanent teeth, permanent teeth is more common than baby teeth. Hypodontia in permanent perform 2.3%~9.6%, any teeth can be missing, the common one would be mandibular and maxilla second premolars and lateral incisors. Patients with molar missing normally will have other teeth missing. There is a small percentage of patient who has only molars missing. Hypodontia can be one or both sides. It takes place symmetrically. Second premolar may have one or both side missing, but maxilla lateral incisor normally missing on both sides and mandibular lateral incisor normally missing on one side.

plans.notes: Orthodontic treatment: teeth alignment, restore occlusion and aesthetics.

sicknesss.notes: The patient is currently going through  pregnancy with gingivitis prior to pregnancy. The clinical manifestations are: the gingival margin and gingival papilla are bright red, soft and shiny, and easy to bleed. Focus on the front teeth. Individual gingival papilla can form gingival tumor during pregnancy, which is more common in the lower front teeth, showing mulberry-like tumor-like hyperplasia and hypertrophy, which is easy to bleed. Gingival tumors during pregnancy increase with the increasing months of pregnancy, and the tumors can gradually shrink by themselves after deliver

sicknesss.name: Medium carie
sicknesss.notes:
Refers to the progression of caries to the superficial layer of dentin.
1、Clinical symptoms: It can be manifested as transient soreness or sensitivity to hot and cold or sweet and sour stimuli, without persistent pain symptoms.
2、Cavities can be formed: caries that occur on the proximal surface or pits and fissures, and the enamel of the marginal ridges or pits and fissures is stained like ink.
3、Probing: The cavity can be reached, the bottom of the cavity is soft, and the cavity wall is slightly sensitive.
4、Bitewing radiographs can be used to confirm the diagnosis of caries on the proximal surface that is difficult to diagnose.

plans.notes: Composite Resin Direct Bonding Restoration
Chairside CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration

sicknesss.name: Deep caries
sicknesss.notes:
Refers to the progress of caries to the middle or deep layer of dentin.
1、Clinically, there are obvious symptoms of sensitivity to cold, hot, sour and sweet stimulation, or transient pain after food impaction, but no spontaneous pain.
2、The cavity is deep, close to the pulp. For caries under pits and fissures, sometimes the opening is not large, but the ink-soaked areas on both sides of the cave edge are relatively large, indicating that the lesion is large in scope.
3、The caries cavity can be reached on probing, and the cavity bottom is located in the middle or deep layer of dentin, which is sensitive on probing, but there is no penetrating foramen.
4、Bitewing radiographs may show carious lesions, but are generally smaller than the actual extent of lesions.

plans.notes: Chairside CAD/CAM inlay/onlay restoration
Composite Resin Direct Bonding Restoration

The edge of the cave is stained, and the gap between the filling agent and the cave wall can be explored, which is soft. X-ray films show there is a transparent area between the filling agent and the bottom of the cave.

sicknesss.name: Acute pulpitis
sicknesss.notes: 1. Typical pain symptoms: (1) Spontaneous sharp pain, paroxysmal attack or intensification; (2) Nighttime pain is more severe than daytime; (3) Temperature stimulation can stimulate or aggravate the pain, and the inflammatory pulp appears suppurative or partially necrotic Sometimes it can be relieved by hot pain and cold; (4) diffuse pain, which spreads long along the distribution area of the trigeminal nerve, and often cannot locate the tooth replacement. 2. Tooth damage or other pathogens that cause pulpal lesions can be found, such as deep caries or other dental hard tissue diseases near the pulp, or fillings can be seen, or deep periodontal pockets can be found. 3. The results of the pulp temperature test and the response to percussion can help locate the affected tooth. The affected tooth may be extremely sensitive or trigger pain to the temperature test, and the pain lasts for a period of time after the stimulus is removed, or it may be manifested as thermal test trigger pain, cold side relief or dullness. Percussion may cause discomfort or slight pain, and percussion pain (±) or percussion pain (+).

plans.notes: Extract
Pulp drainage, crown restoration after root canal treatment

sicknesss.name: Chronic pulpitis
sicknesss.notes: 1. Spontaneous dull pain, dull pain or timed pain can be localized, there may also be a history of severe spontaneous pain or long-term cold or hot pain history. There may be a history of food embedded in the hole causing pain, or there may be no obvious spontaneous pain symptoms. 2. It can detect deep caries, fillings or other dental hard tissue diseases near the pulp, or deep periodontal pockets. Probing in the cave is relatively slow. Sometimes deep probing can cause severe pain and a small amount of bleeding (ulcer type), and sometimes protruding pulp polyps can be seen in the cavity (hyperplastic type), or there may be no pulp hole after removing the decay (locked type). 3. The response of affected teeth to temperature test is mostly slow response, especially the slow pain response to thermal stimulation is more obvious. Sensitivity to cold, heat, or insensitivity to cold may also occur; symptoms often persist for a period of time after the temperature stimulus is removed. 4. Slight pain (+) or discomfort (±) on percussion, that is, pain on percussion (+) or pain on percussion (±).

plans.notes: Extract
Crown restoration after root canal treatment

sicknesss.name: Reversible pulpitis
sicknesss.notes: 1. The affected teeth are transiently sensitive to temperature stimuli, especially to cold stimuli, but there is no history of spontaneous pain. 2. Dental or periodontal tissue diseases that cause pulpal lesions can be found. For example, the affected tooth has hard tissue damage near the pulp (deep caries, deep wedge-shaped defect, etc.), joint trauma, or deep periodontal pockets. 3. The affected teeth are transiently sensitive to the temperature test (especially the cold side), and respond quickly, and the symptoms are relieved immediately after removing the stimulus. 4. Percussion is the same as the normal control tooth, that is, percussion pain (-).

plans.notes: Appease or adjust, followed by resin filling or root canal treatment and crown restoration
Extract

sicknesss.name: Pulp necrosis
sicknesss.notes: 1. No symptoms. There may be a history of spontaneous pain, trauma, orthodontics or filling and repair history. 2. There may be deep caries or other dental hard tissue diseases in the crown, or there may be fillings, deep periodontal pockets, etc.; complete crowns can also be seen. The crown color is changed and dull. 3. There is no response to the pulp vitality test (temperature test and electrical test). 4. Percussion is the same as normal control teeth or discomfort. That is, percussion pain (-) or percussion pain (±). 5. Gingival fistula without apical origin. 6. X-ray films showed no obvious abnormalities in periapical images. 7. There is no response to the penetrating gap of deep carious cavity, and there may be a foul smell when the pulp cavity is opened.

plans.notes: Root canal treatment
Plasticizing
Extract

sicknesss.name: Chronic apical periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: 1. No obvious symptoms, chewing discomfort, may have had a history of pain and swelling. 2. Deep caries, fillings, other dental hard tissue diseases, crown discoloration or deep periodontal pockets can be seen in the affected teeth. 3. Painless percussion or mild discomfort, that is, percussion pain (-) or percussion pain (±), the affected tooth is generally not loose, sometimes gingival sinus openings can be seen, and skin sinus openings are occasionally seen. 4. There is no response to the pulp vitality test. 5. X-ray films show that there are radiolucent areas with different shapes around the apex: chronic periapical abscess——the boundary is unclear, diffuse and irregular; periapical granuloma——the boundary is clear and round; Pericyst—a round, more radiolucent area of destruction with a well-defined white line; insertion of a gutta-percha-tipped diagnostic wire into the gingival sinus can indicate a lesion draining through a fistula. 6. The X-ray image of periapical dense osteitis does not show the transmission shadow after bone destruction, but the localized dense radiograph of the apical bone, which is mostly found in the mandibular posterior teeth. 7. After opening the pulp cavity of the tooth with apical cyst, clear cystic fluid overflows in the root canal, and cholesterol crystals can be seen in the cystic fluid smear microscopic examination.

plans.notes: Root canal treatment and crown restoration
Extract
Apical surgery

ailments.name: Acute serous periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: 1. In the initial stage, there is only slight pain or discomfort, floating, numbness and swelling, and the teeth feel comfortable after clenching; then spontaneous dull pain, occlusal pain, and floating sensation of the affected teeth, not only can not relieve the symptoms when occlusal, but cause more severe symptoms Pain that interferes with eating. The clinical duration of the serous phase is very short, the pain range is limited to the root of the affected tooth, does not cause radiation, and the patient can specify the affected tooth. 2. Caries, fillings, other dental hard tissue diseases, crown discoloration or deep periodontal zone can be seen in the affected teeth. 3. Suffering from tooth percussion pain (+)~(++), may have I° looseness. 4. There is discomfort or pain at the root tip of the affected tooth, and there is no obvious redness and swelling of the gums. 5. There is no response to the pulp vitality test, but the inflammation of young permanent teeth or deciduous teeth may spread to the periapical area before the pulp necrosis, so there may be a response or even pain during the vitality test. 6. X-ray examination of periapical tissue images showed no obvious abnormalities.

plans.notes: 1.Pulp opening and drainage, and complete root canal treatment 2. Extraction after pulp opening and drainage 3. Antibacterial drugs and analgesic drugs can be applied systemically

ailments.name: Acute suppurative periapical periodontitis
ailments.notes: 1. Spontaneous pain and severe percussion pain of the affected tooth, obvious loosening, mild percussion pain and loosening of adjacent teeth in the later stage, and inflammation of the surrounding soft tissues. Clinically, it can be divided into three stages: 1) Apical abscess: spontaneous and persistent severe throbbing pain of the affected tooth, aggravated sense of elongation, percussion pain (++)~(+++), loosening of I°~II°, root The gums at the tip were flushed and slightly painful to the touch. 2) Subperiosteal abscess: The course of the disease has been three to five days, and the patient is extremely painful, which affects sleep and eating: a. The affected tooth is persistent, pulsating and throbbing, the pain reaches the peak, and the affected tooth feels floating and loose. Pain upon light touch of the affected tooth; b. Pain on percussion (+++), loosening II°~III°, flushing and swelling of the gums at the apical area, flattening of the transition groove, pain on palpation and deep fluctuations; c. Regional lymph node enlargement and palpable pain; mandibular molars may be accompanied by restricted opening, and severe cases may be complicated by cellulitis in the corresponding part of the maxillofacial region; d. The patient has a painful face, general discomfort, and may be accompanied by elevated body temperature (generally not exceeding 38 degrees), white blood cell count increased. 3) Submucosal abscess: The pain of the affected tooth is relieved, the pain on percussion is relieved, the mucosa in the apical region shows a limited hemispherical bulge, there is obvious fluctuation on palpation, and the systemic symptoms are relieved. 2. Deep caries, fillings, other dental hard tissue diseases, crown discoloration or deep periodontal pockets can be seen in the affected teeth. 3. X-rays showed that the hard bone plate in the apical area disappeared or the periodontal space was widened, or it was accompanied by a decrease in bone density around the apex. There may also be no significant change. If it is an acute episode of chronic apical periodontitis, X-ray films can show a radiolucent area with bone destruction.

plans.notes: Extract after pulpotomy and drainage 3. Antibiotics and analgesics can be applied systemically
Open pulp and drain (cut and drain pus as appropriate), and complete root canal treatment.

sicknesss.name: Invasive periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: Rapid periodontal tissue destruction, X-ray film shows first molar mesial-distal vertical bone resorption, forming an arc-shaped resorption, incisors are horizontal bone resorption, predilection tooth position: limited to first permanent molars or incisors , involving at least two permanent teeth, one of which is a first molar, and no more than two non-first molars and incisors

plans.notes: Comprehensive Treatment
Operation treatment
Maintenance treatment
Basic treatment
Pharmacotherapy

sicknesss.name: Chronic periodontitis
sicknesss.notes: The most common periodontitis. The main clinical manifestations are: 1. Bleeding gums when brushing teeth or eating, or odor in the mouth, loose teeth, weak chewing or swelling, and pain in the late stage. 2. The lesion can affect most teeth or a group of teeth in the whole mouth, and the course of the disease is longer. 3. Main clinical manifestations: gingival inflammation, loss of attachment and periodontal pocket formation, alveolar bone resorption, tooth loosening and even loss in the late stage. 4. Associated lesions include gingival recession, furcation lesions, retrograde pulpitis, periodontal abscess, etc. 5. The lesion degree is often consistent with the local irritant. 6. Auxiliary X-ray examination showed different degrees of alveolar bone resorption.

plans.notes: Oral hygiene education; remove plaque and calculus; remove or control partial pathogenic factors; auxiliary systemic and partial drug therapy; extract unreserved teeth at an appropriate time; surgical treatment to establish a balanced occlusal relationship; periodontal maintenance.

ailments.name: Acute Periodontal Abscess
ailments.notes: Sudden onset,there are oval or hemispherical protrusions on the gums，congestive &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; swollen with shiny surface ; early pain is severe and throbbing, the affected teeth have floating feeling, weak in chewing &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; uncomfortable to percussion; swelling will be limited in the later stage; surface becomes soft with sense of fluctuation and pain is slightly relieved; deep periodontal pockets with purulent secretions can be probed &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; swelling subsides after the abscess is ruptured, Tooth loosening is obvious; in severe cases, there may be systemic symptoms with increased white blood cells and local lymphadenectasis. X-ray examination: heavy alveolar bone resorption, may form intrabony pocket.

plans.notes: 3. Incision and drainage
4. Medication-assisted treatment
2. Supragingival scaling
1. Oral Health Instruction

ailments.name: Chronic periodontal abscess
ailments.notes: Caused by delayed treatment or recurrent attacks of acute Periodontal Abscess; usually no obvious symptoms, may have pain when biting, mild percussion pain or discomfort; acute abscess becomes chronic after rupture, there is a sinus  canal opening on the surface of the abscess, and there is purulent secretion when pressed. X-ray examination: moderate to severe alveolar bone resorption and destruction, sometimes the causative factors such as lateral root canal penetration, vertical root fracture or root fracture at the post core can be seen

plans.notes: Affected tooth cannot be saved : Supragingival scaling, and extract the tooth after the abscess subsides
Affected tooth can be saved: basic periodontal treatment ;

sicknesss.name: Combined periodontal-endodontic lesions
sicknesss.notes: The lesions originate from either dental pulp, periodontal tissues surrounding the involved tooth or teeth or both. there are three types of clinical manifestations: 1. derived from dental pulp, pulpal infection spreads into the bone adjacent to the apex immediately, or deepest tip of the root , this forms a periapical abscess. If this infection proliferates coronally, or toward the crown of the tooth, it may then communicate with the alveolar bone and the oral cavity as it spreads through the periodontal ligament, gradually becoming an endo-perio lesion 2. derived from periodontal, infection originate in a periodontal pocket and may be spread through accessory canals into the root canals of the tooth, which leads to inflammation of the tooth’s pulp. 3.True combined lesion, Periodontal lesions and pulp lesions occur in the same tooth, and each is  independent. when the lesion develops to a severe stage, the two may fuse and affect each other

plans.notes: Affected tooth can be saved: 1. Root canal therapy; 2. basic periodontal treatment ,Consider periodontal surgery according to the situation
Affected tooth cannot be saved: extraction

sicknesss.name: Gingival recession
sicknesss.notes: Gingival margin is displaced to the root of the cemento-enamel junction, Or there may be retraction of the gingival papilla at the same time, resulting in exposure of the root, where alveolar bone resorption and periodontal attachment loss occur accordingly

plans.notes:
Treatment plan: 1. Mucogingival surgery
                               2. Guided tissue regeneration
                               3. Coronally advanced flap
                               4. Gum graft surgery
                               5. Orthodontics apical vertically sliced

sicknesss.name: 牙周炎
sicknesss.notes: 由牙菌斑、牙结石、创伤等因素造成的牙周组织的慢性炎症。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，可进行牙周洁治（俗称洗牙）。

sicknesss.name: 牙齿缺损
sicknesss.notes: 由龋病、外伤、磨损、酸蚀等造成的牙齿形态的不完整。

plans.notes: 及时进行充填治疗或修复治疗。

sicknesss.name: 牙齿缺失
sicknesss.notes: 俗称缺牙，牙齿缺失后会影响到正常的饮食、发音及美观，建议及时修复

plans.notes: 及时进行牙齿修复治疗。

sicknesss.name: 牙龈炎
sicknesss.notes: 牙龈炎是牙龈边缘牙菌斑堆积造成的牙龈炎症，可表现为牙龈红肿、牙龈出血。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，可进行牙周洁治（俗称洗牙）。

sicknesss.name: 融合牙
sicknesss.notes: 融合牙是一种畸形牙齿，一般是在两个牙胚发育期间，相邻的牙胚之间受到了一定的刺激，两个牙胚就长在并一起萌出。

plans.notes: 可拔除或进行修复治疗。

sicknesss.name: 错颌畸形
sicknesss.notes: 指牙齿、牙弓、颌骨和颅面位置相互间的关系不调

plans.notes: 某些习惯动作是造成一些牙颌畸形的原因,称之为口腔不良习惯,常见的有吮指习惯、不良舌习惯、不良唇习惯等，应尽早克服；如果已经出现错颌畸形表现，建议尽快就医。

sicknesss.name: 健康牙
sicknesss.notes: 世界卫生组织制定的牙齿健康标准：1、牙齿清洁，2、无龋洞，3、无疼痛感，4、牙龈颜色正常，5、无出血现象。

plans.notes: 保持良好的口腔卫生习惯，定期进行口腔检查。

sicknesss.name: 牙结石
sicknesss.notes: 保持良好的口腔卫生习惯，定期进行口腔检查。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，可进行牙周洁治（俗称洗牙）。

sicknesss.name: 畸形牙
sicknesss.notes: 畸形中央尖、畸形舌侧窝、畸形舌侧尖、牙中牙，同属于牙齿形态畸形。

plans.notes: 可拔除或进行修复治疗。

sicknesss.name: 牙齿色素附着
sicknesss.notes: 饮食、烟茶咖啡等附着于牙齿表面形成的黄或黑色斑块，或者四环素等药物造成的牙齿呈灰、黄或棕色。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，必要时可洗牙去除色素。

ailments.name: 浅龋
ailments.notes: 龋坏限于釉质，一般无明显龋洞，无自觉症状，探查也无反应。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，可能需要进行龋齿充填（俗称补牙）。

ailments.name: 中龋
ailments.notes: 龋坏达到牙本质层，有明显龋洞，对外界刺激可有敏感症状。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，并尽快进行龋齿充填（俗称补牙）。

ailments.name: 深龋
ailments.notes: 一般表现为大而深的龋洞，对外界刺激(如冷、热、甜、酸和食物嵌入等)反应较重。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，并尽快进行龋齿充填（俗称补牙）。

ailments.name: 拥挤
ailments.notes: 牙列拥挤是最常见的错合畸形，可表现为牙齿拥挤错位排列不齐。

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 间隙
ailments.notes: 牙齿之间存在明显间隙

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 反合
ailments.notes: 分为单牙反颌和多牙反颌，多牙反颌俗称“地包天”，通常表现为下牙包住上牙。

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 开合
ailments.notes: 指正常咬合时上下颌部分牙齿在垂直向无接触。

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 锁合
ailments.notes: 锁合在临床上可分为正锁合和反锁合。正锁合是指上颌后牙舌尖的舌斜面位于下颌后牙颊尖的颊斜面的颊侧，合面无咬合接触，临床较为多见；反锁合是指上后牙颊尖的颊斜面位于下后牙舌尖舌斜面的舌侧，合面多无咬合接触，临床上较少见。正反锁合可发生于单侧或者双侧，最常见于上下颌第二磨牙，前磨牙区的锁合也较常发生。

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 深覆合
ailments.notes: 指上牙包住下牙的范围超过了2～3毫米

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

ailments.name: 深覆盖
ailments.notes: 是指上前牙切端至下前牙唇面的最大水平距离超过2-3毫米，也就是上颌前牙比下颌前牙向前突超过2-3毫米

plans.notes: 可进行活动矫治器、隐形矫治器或固定矫治器治疗。

sicknesss.notes: 由牙菌斑、牙结石、创伤等因素造成，表现为牙龈红肿出血、口臭、牙龈退缩甚至松动。

sicknesss.name: 牙齿缺失
sicknesss.notes: 俗称缺牙，牙齿缺失后会影响到正常的饮食、发音及美观，建议及时修复

plans.notes: 及时进行牙齿修复治疗。

sicknesss.name: 牙结石
sicknesss.notes: 沉积在牙齿表面已钙化的牙菌斑及软垢，牙齿表面可呈现黄白色至棕黑色。

plans.notes: 改善口腔卫生习惯，可进行牙周洁治（俗称洗牙）。

ailments.name: 非生理性
ailments.notes: 牙齿受外界酸侵蚀以及物理因素，硬组织发生进行性丧失

plans.notes: 对因治疗：调整喜酸性饮食习惯，酸食后的漱口、定期用3%的小苏打溶液漱口。改进生产设备，防止空气酸雾或酸酐浓度过高。酸性药物使用的注意事项。
对症治疗：对牙齿敏感症可进行脱敏后充填；牙髓炎和根尖周病的根管治疗后的冠修复。

ailments.name: 生理性
ailments.notes: 自身身体分泌破坏口腔酸碱平衡，硬组织发生进行性丧失

plans.notes: 对症治疗：对牙齿敏感症可进行脱敏后充填；牙髓炎和根尖周病的根管治疗后的冠修复。
对因治疗：治疗有关的全身疾病，避免暴力刷牙。

ailments.name: 中度
ailments.notes: 着色牙由棕黄色至黑灰色。

plans.notes: 对症治疗：着色牙可通过光固化复合树脂修复、瓷冠修复、贴面或漂白等方法进行治疗
对因治疗：为防止四环素牙的发生，妊娠和哺乳的妇女以及8岁以下的小儿不宜使用四环素类药物。

ailments.name: 重度
ailments.notes: 牙表面可见到明显的带状着色，颜色呈黄-灰色或黑色。

plans.notes: 对因治疗：为防止四环素牙的发生，妊娠和哺乳的妇女以及8岁以下的小儿不宜使用四环素类药物。
对症治疗：着色牙可通过光固化复合树脂修复、瓷冠修复、贴面或漂白等方法进行治疗

ailments.name: 极重度
ailments.notes: 牙表面着色深，严重者可呈灰褐色。

plans.notes: 对症治疗：着色牙可通过光固化复合树脂修复、瓷冠修复、贴面或漂白等方法进行治疗
对因治疗：为防止四环素牙的发生，妊娠和哺乳的妇女以及8岁以下的小儿不宜使用四环素类药物。

ailments.name: 轻度
ailments.notes: 整个牙面呈现黄色或灰色，且分布均匀，没有带状着色

plans.notes: 对因治疗：为防止四环素牙的发生，妊娠和哺乳的妇女以及8岁以下的小儿不宜使用四环素类药物。
对症治疗：着色牙可通过光固化复合树脂修复、瓷冠修复、贴面或漂白等方法进行治疗

ailments.name: 半月形切牙
ailments.notes: 切牙的切缘比牙颈部狭窄，切缘中央有半月形缺陷，切牙之间有较大空隙

plans.notes: 对症治疗：对梅毒牙可用牙体修复技术进行修复，如冠修复。

对因治疗：在妊娠早期治疗梅寿，是预防先天性梅毒牙的有效方法。青𩆨素是治疗梅毒最有效的药幼。
若在妊娠早期开始规范使用抗生素行抗梅毒治疗，95% 的婴儿可免得先天性梅毒。这样也就可以防止梅毒牙的发生。

ailments.name: 桑甚状磨牙
ailments.notes: 第一恒磨牙的牙尖皱缩，表面粗糙，牙釉质呈多个不规则的小结节和坑窝凹陷，散在于近合面处，呈桑甚状，牙尖向中央凑拢，牙横径最大处是在牙颈部

plans.notes:
对因治疗：在妊娠早期治疗梅寿，是预防先天性梅毒牙的有效方法。青𩆨素是治疗梅毒最有效的药幼。
若在妊娠早期开始规范使用抗生素行抗梅毒治疗，95% 的婴儿可免得先天性梅毒。这样也就可以防止梅毒牙的发生。
对症治疗：对梅毒牙可用牙体修复技术进行修复，如冠修复。

ailments.name: 蕾状磨牙
ailments.notes: 第一恒磨牙较正常牙小，园顶状：近中面观，牙尖聚拢，但冠部无沟隙或缺损环绕;除了外形畸形外，牙齿表面光滑。

plans.notes: 对症治疗：对梅毒牙可用牙体修复技术进行修复，如冠修复。

对因治疗：在妊娠早期治疗梅寿，是预防先天性梅毒牙的有效方法。青𩆨素是治疗梅毒最有效的药幼。
若在妊娠早期开始规范使用抗生素行抗梅毒治疗，95% 的婴儿可免得先天性梅毒。这样也就可以防止梅毒牙的发生。

sicknesss.name: 牙结石
sicknesss.notes: 细菌使唾液的酸碱值升高而呈碱性，造成唾液中的蛋白质分解，放出钙盐，沉淀于牙齿表面而成；开始是乳白色的软垢，会因逐渐的钙化而变硬；颜色呈现出黄色、棕色、黑色。

plans.notes: 1、正确刷牙；2、牙周洁治

sicknesss.name: 牙齿色素附着
sicknesss.notes: 1、外源性：经常饮用含有色素的饮料，如长期大量饮用浓茶、咖啡、可乐、食用含有色素的药物，以及长期大量吸烟，食物、饮料、药物或者烟草当中的色素，就可以沉积在牙面上，出现牙齿色素沉淀。2、内源性。

plans.notes: 牙周洁治。
正确刷牙。

ailments.name: 残根且根尖根向骨量大于5mm，唇侧骨板不完整或根尖区有急性炎症
ailments.notes: 恒牙由于龋坏等原因而致使牙冠基本缺失，仅剩余牙根；且骨量不足（或者根尖区有炎症）

plans.notes: 不需要垂直骨增量拔牙+早期种植
牙体治疗+直接桩冠修复

ailments.name: 残根且根尖根向骨量不足5mm，唇侧骨瓣不完整或薄龈生物型或没有急性炎症
ailments.notes: 恒牙由于龋坏等原因而致使牙冠基本缺失，仅剩余牙根；且骨量略微不够。

plans.notes: 拔牙+位点保存+延期种植
牙体治疗+直接桩冠修复

ailments.name: 残根且根尖根向骨量不足5mm，唇侧骨板不完整或或根尖区有急性炎症或薄龈生物型
ailments.notes: 恒牙由于龋坏等原因而致使牙冠基本缺失，仅剩余牙根；且骨条件不足。

plans.notes: 牙体治疗+直接桩冠修复
拔牙+延期种植

ailments.notes: 恒牙由于龋坏等原因而致使牙冠的大部分缺损，仅剩余部分冠，但骨条件很好。

plans.notes: 牙体治疗+桩冠修复
拔牙+即刻种植+植骨
牙体治疗+冠修复

ailments.name: 残冠且根尖根向骨量大于5mm，唇侧骨板不完整或根尖区有急性炎症
ailments.notes: 恒牙由于龋坏等原因而致使牙冠的大部分缺损，仅剩余部分冠，且骨量不足（或者根尖区有炎症）

plans.notes: 牙体治疗+桩冠修复
不需要垂直骨增量拔牙+早期

plans.notes: 牙体治疗+桩冠修复
拔牙+位点保存+延期种植

ailments.notes: 诊断解释：骨条件很好，拔完牙马上就能种牙

ailments.notes: 诊断解释：骨量不足（或者根尖区有炎症），拔牙以后需要等牙龈长好了（或炎症消了）再种牙

ailments.notes: 诊断解释：骨条件不足，需要等骨头长好后再种牙

ailments.notes: 牙床高度宽度条件一般，骨条件比较好

ailments.name: 疼痛
ailments.notes: 边缘不密合导致继发龋的形成及造成牙髓炎，甚至根尖周炎；咬合创伤。

plans.notes: 拆除修复体对症治疗后重新修复

ailments.name: 食物嵌塞
ailments.notes: 修复体的形态恢复不当：咬合面的形态恢复不当,缺少边缘嵴及溢出沟,牙尖斜面过陡;接触区的形态恢复不当。②冠修复体边缘位置不合适、边缘不密合等，可引起龈炎、牙周炎、牙龈萎缩、继发食物嵌塞。

plans.notes: 拆除冠重新修复
调合

ailments.name: 龈缘炎
ailments.notes: 修复体轴面外形不良，如短冠修复体轴面突度不足，食物沖击牙龈；轴面突度过大，食物向齦方排滥时无法与齦组织接触，使银组织失去生理按摩作用，也可造成局部龈缘炎;②冠边缘过长，边缘抛光不良，修复体边缘有悬突或台阶;③嵌塞食物压迫

plans.notes: 拆除修复体
保守治疗：可局部用消炎镇痛药消除炎症,调合，尽可能消除或减少致病因素

ailments.name: 修复体破裂、折断、穿孔
ailments.notes: 材料抗力不足以支持正常殆力,玻璃陶瓷的脆性较大，树脂的强度较低，断裂部位多发生在修复体的薄弱处;②制作因素，如局部棱角锐边等形成应力集中，铸造修复体砂眼，瓷修复体裂纹、烤瓷修复体金瓷结合不良等,容易出现崩瓷或折断;

plans.notes:
前牙全瓷冠或金属烤瓷冠局部破裂、折断，可用氢氟酸酸蚀断面 1~2分钟，冲洗吹千后使用硅
烧偶联剂,缺损处以光固化复合树脂恢复外形,也可在瓷层做小的固位洞形,增加树脂材料的固位。大范围破损和存在穿孔的修复体应将应拆除重做。

ailments.name: 修复体固位不足
ailments.notes: 轴壁聚合度过大,合龈距过短而末设计辅助固位形，修复体不密合，桩过短，固位形不良;固位形不良或修复体与牙体不密合应

plans.notes: 重新设计固位形并进行牙体预备，或以桩核恢复固位形后再进行修复。

ailments.name: 创伤
ailments.notes: 合力过大，不良咀嚼习惯,合力集中，侧向力过大;

plans.notes: 磨改调合抛光后重新粘固。

ailments.name: 粘固失败
ailments.notes:
如粘固材料选用不当,粘固剂失效,粘接程序或操作不当，牙面及修复体粘固面未清洁干净，干燥不彻底,气枪喷气中含油、唾液、龈沟液或血液污染，粘固剂尚未完全结固时患者
咀嚼破坏结固等。

plans.notes: 可去除残留粘固剂,粘固面作常规处理，选用优质粘固材料重新粘固。

sicknesss.name: 恒牙先天缺失
sicknesss.notes: 先天缺牙可发生在乳牙列，也可发生在恒牙列，恒牙较乳牙至见。恒牙列部分先天缺牙发生率高达2.3%~9.6%。恒牙列中任何一颗牙都存先天缺失的可能，除第三磨牙外最常缺失的是下颌第二前磨牙上颌侧切牙和上颌第二前磨牙，下领切牙也是先天缺失的好发牙位。最少缺失的牙齿是第一恒麼牙，其次是第二恒磨牙。磨牙缺失的患者多伴有其他牙齿的缺失，单纯缺磨牙者少。牙齿缺失可发生在单侧也可发生在双侧。缺失牙位多呈对称性分布。第二前磨牙的先天缺失可见有对称发生或者单侧发生。上颌侧切牙常常双侧同时缺失，而下颌切牙则以单侧缺失居多。

plans.notes: 成年后种植修复
正畸调整：排齐牙弓，恢复咬合及改善美观。

ailments.name: 重度牙列拥挤
ailments.notes: 拥挤度大于8mm

30分钟内再植入

sicknesss.name: 舌系带过短
sicknesss.notes: 伸舌呈“W”形，卷舌困难，影响发音

plans.notes: 局麻下剪开系带，长度至伸舌时”W“消失，纵行缝合
